original: 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they similar.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu de ma thag pa bar ma chod pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ma thag pa bar ma chod pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not similar because the effect is not immediately contiguous without interval.

original: ji ltar sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu de ma thag pa yin pa ltar 'di'i 'bras bu ni de ltar de ma thag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon la sogs pa'i 'bras bu de ma thag pa yin pa ltar 'di'i 'bras bu ni de ltar de ma thag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the effect of a seed, etc. is immediately contiguous, so too is the effect of that.

original: gal te 'bras bu de ma thag tu skyes kyang mi mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu de ma thag tu skyes kyang mi mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that even though the effect is immediately contiguous, it is not seen?

original: de ci ltar de ma thag tu med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar de ma thag tu med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be immediately contiguous if it does not exist?

original: smras pa / 'bras bur gyur pa mngon sum gyi don la yang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / 'bras bur gyur pa mngon sum gyi don la yang ngo //
translated: We reply: The effect is directly perceived in the present.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu lkog tu gyur pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mngon par mtho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu lkog tu gyur pa yin na ni /
translated: If the effect of the higher realms were hidden,

original: the tshom za ba nyid yin na lkog tu gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid yin na lkog tu gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: it would be doubtful. But it is not hidden.

original: 'di ltar yul nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bde ba rang gi rgyud la yod pa dang / yul yang bdag nyid dang 'brel par rig pa ni mngon par mtho ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bde ba rang gi rgyud la yod pa dang / yul yang bdag nyid dang 'brel par rig pa ni mngon par mtho ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the higher realms are the pleasure that exists in one‚Äôs continuum, the reason for the ascertainment of the object, and the object itself is related to oneself.

original: de ni 'di'i lkog tu gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di'i lkog tu gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not hidden that this is so.

original: des na de ma thag pa med par nges pas 'dra ba med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ma thag pa med par nges pas 'dra ba med par nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is certain that there is no immediately preceding condition, it is certain that there is no similarity.

original: 'bras bu de dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'dra bar yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'dra bar yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: It is also certain that the effect is not possessed by that which is similar.

original: de med pas de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyin ci log pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pas de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyin ci log pa yin no //
translated: Since it does not exist, the error is that its effect does not exist.

original: 'di phyin ci log pa yin gyi bden pa'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di phyin ci log pa yin gyi bden pa'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nyid ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that this is an error and not the meaning of the truth?

original: rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom the cause, etc.‚Äù

original: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa zhes bya ba khyi smyon gyi dug gis 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byi ba dang khyi smyon pa zhes bya ba khyi smyon gyi dug gis 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Like a mouse and a rabid dog, like the poison of a rabid dog.

original: 'di ltar de ni dug zhugs ma thag nyid du ni mi 'gyur gyi /üîΩ'on kyang lhan cig byed par 'dod pa'i @218a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni dug zhugs ma thag nyid du ni mi 'gyur gyi / 'on kyang lhan cig byed par 'dod pa'i @218a * //
translated: Thus, it does not become poison immediately after it is injected,üîΩbut rather, when a specific time period has passed,

original: dus kyi khyad par nye bar gyur ba na 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par nye bar gyur ba na 'byung ba yin te /
translated: it occurs in dependence on other conditions,

original: rgyu gzhan nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and there is no other cause.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: The same is true of other things.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not only that which is not seen that is not established,üîΩbut also that which is seen is not established.

original: 'on kyang dngos po de'i 'bras bu chod pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa dang / dbang po las 'das pa'i don yod pa la yang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu 'am dbang po las 'das pa'i dngos po 'di la bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i mi dmigs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po de'i 'bras bu chod pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa dang / dbang po las 'das pa'i don yod pa la yang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu 'am dbang po las 'das pa'i dngos po 'di la bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i mi dmigs pa tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: However, there is no contradiction in the existence of the capacity to produce the effect of that thing and the existence of a transcendent object, so mere non-apprehension, which lacks the distinction of being suitable to be seen, is not a valid cognition regarding the cause of prosperity or a transcendent thing.

original: mngon par mtho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dgag par mi nus pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dgag par mi nus pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi //
translated: Not only is it impossible to negate the cause of prosperity, etc.,

original: bsgrub par yang mi nus pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni de 'byung ba la tshad ma ci yod ce na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par yang mi nus pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni de 'byung ba la tshad ma ci yod ce na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: but it is also impossible to establish it. This is stated in What is the valid cognition of its arising?

original: gzhan dag de ltar dogs par byas nas spong ba de bzlog pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag de ltar dogs par byas nas spong ba de bzlog pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Others, having suspected this, deny it. To refute that, for that very reason is stated.

original: shin tu dbang po las 'das pa'i don bsgrub pa dang gnod par byed pa med pa la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa the tshom bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: shin tu dbang po las 'das pa'i don bsgrub pa dang gnod par byed pa med pa la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa the tshom bya bar rigs so //
translated: It is proper for the rational to doubt that which is extremely beyond the senses, that which is established, and that which is not harmful.

original: yang na gal te dngos po gang zhig bzlog par yang mi nus pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang med pa de la de ltar brtag par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang na gal te dngos po gang zhig bzlog par yang mi nus pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang med pa de la de ltar brtag par ni mi rigs te /
translated: Or, if a thing is not capable of being refuted and there is no means of valid cognition to establish it, then it is not proper to imagine it in that way.

original: 'di la res 'ga' sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la res 'ga' sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma srid pa yin no //
translated: In this case, it is possible that a means of valid cognition to establish it may occur at some point.

original: bdag nyid kyis sngar re zhig ma shes pa 'ga' zhig phyis shes pa de bzhin du ma nges pa'i tshad ma yang goms pa'i dbang gis du gzhan du shes par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis sngar re zhig ma shes pa 'ga' zhig phyis shes pa de bzhin du ma nges pa'i tshad ma yang goms pa'i dbang gis du gzhan du shes par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Just as something that one did not previously know at all is known later, in the same way, a means of valid cognition that is not ascertained can come to be known in another way through the power of habituation.

original: yang na shes pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyis nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na shes pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyis nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it can be taught by another person who knows it.

original: de ltar na gzhung gi don ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul nyid la rtog pa dang ldan pa the tshom za bar rigs kyi yul med par nges pa ni yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung gi don ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul nyid la rtog pa dang ldan pa the tshom za bar rigs kyi yul med par nges pa ni yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the treatise is this: ‚ÄúIt is reasonable to doubt the existence of the object of a valid cognition that establishes something, but it is not reasonable to ascertain the nonexistence of the object.‚Äù

original: slob dpon bdag nyid la tshad ma yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon bdag nyid la tshad ma yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the master himself does not have a valid cognition.

original: slob dpon gyis ni phyogs gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bkod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni phyogs gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bkod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the master has not presented a valid cognition that establishes the cause of high status anywhere else.

original: des na don nam tshad ma la the tshom za ba'i phyir spang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na don nam tshad ma la the tshom za ba'i phyir spang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is not to be rejected because of doubt about the object or the valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu chod pa yang skyed pa de'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa'i don 'di la mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rang bzhin nam 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i don 'ga' zhig gi yod pa'i shes par byed pa go bar
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu chod pa yang skyed pa de'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa'i don 'di la mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu la sogs pa rang bzhin nam 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i don 'ga' zhig gi yod pa'i shes par byed pa go bar
translated: Because it generates a result even when obstructed, therefore it is understood that the eye and so on are the cause of higher rebirth and so forth, or they are the cause of some object such as attachment and so on.üîΩ

original: byed pa ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: byed pa ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Because the effect is produced even when it is obstructed, therefore, the cause of high status and so on is not established as the cause of any existent object such as the object of freedom from attachment and so on that is beyond the senses.

original: mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no clear seeing.

original: 'di skad du don 'ga' zhig gis shes par byed pa ni mthong ba nyid yin na de yang mi gsal ba des na rnam pa thams cad la nges par byed pa ma yin @218b no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du don 'ga' zhig gis shes par byed pa ni mthong ba nyid yin na de yang mi gsal ba des na rnam pa thams cad la nges par byed pa ma yin @218b no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is saying that if something is a cause of knowledge of some object, it must be seeing, but if it is unclear, it does not ascertain all aspects.

original: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: Also, because causes produce effects.

original: des na 'bras bu de ma thag pa mthong ba med ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid khas blangs par mi nus te /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu de ma thag pa mthong ba med ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid khas blangs par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, because the effect is not seen immediately, it is not possible to accept that it is the cause of high status through its being an effect.

original: dper na du ba mthong bas me skyed pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba mthong bas me skyed pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when smoke is seen, there is the capacity to infer fire.

original: de bzhin du dbang po las 'das pa'i don rnams kyi mthong ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid gsal ba med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po las 'das pa'i don rnams kyi mthong ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid gsal ba med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, the seeing of objects that are beyond the senses, which is characterized by mental consciousness, is not apprehended by direct perception because it is not clear.

original: mthong ba gsal ba med pa nyid kyis na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nam 'bras bu mthong ngam de ltar nges par mi rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba gsal ba med pa nyid kyis na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nam 'bras bu mthong ngam de ltar nges par mi rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And because the seeing is not clear, one does not understand the nature of the object to be established or its result, nor does one ascertain it in that way.

original: 'di ni dngos po yod pa dag la yang lta ba po'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po yod pa dag la yang lta ba po'i skyon yin no //
translated: This is the fault of the seer with regard to existent things.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur yong pa de dag gi skyon de yang rgyu rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur yong pa de dag gi skyon de yang rgyu rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad do //
translated: The fault of those causes and results is explained by ‚ÄúThose causes, even though they have the capacity to produce the result, do not always produce the result.

original: de dag rang gi rgyun la nus pa yod pa yin yang rgyu tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rang gi rgyun la nus pa yod pa yin yang rgyu tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù Even though they have the capacity in their own continuum, there is no certainty that they will produce a result characterized by a different cause.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu mi skyed na ni dngos po nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu mi skyed na ni dngos po nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not produce an effect by its own nature, then it follows that it is not a real thing.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi 'bras bu mthong bas ni dngos po de rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi 'bras bu mthong bas ni dngos po de rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: An effect is not inferred from a thing that is seen to be related to it by its own nature.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba nyid yin no //
translated: Rather, it is seen.

original: de'i phyir 'dir gzhan gyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu nyid bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gzhan gyi rgyud kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu nyid bzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, here the effect is taken to be related to it by another nature.

original: de ni byed par ma nges pa'am byas kyang mthong bar ma nges pa'am mthong yang de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni byed par ma nges pa'am byas kyang mthong bar ma nges pa'am mthong yang de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not certain that it is a cause, or even if it is, it is not certain that it is seen, or even if it is seen, it is not understood to be its effect.

original: de la mi dmigs pa dang mngon sum dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa dang mngon sum dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is neither nonapprehension nor perception of it.

original: mig bzhin du mthong ba gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i sgo nas ni thams cad 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig bzhin du mthong ba gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i sgo nas ni thams cad 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not established in every case by the method of the eye, which is not seen elsewhere.

original: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang shes par byed pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang shes par byed pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, perception and inference are not the means of knowing it.

original: de tsam gyis ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don spong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don spong ba ma yin no //
translated: But that does not mean that the object that is beyond the senses is rejected.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis ma dmigs kyang yang rim gyis mthar gyis rtsig phug na gnas pa la sogs pa'i don 'ba' zhig mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis ma dmigs kyang yang rim gyis mthar gyis rtsig phug na gnas pa la sogs pa'i don 'ba' zhig mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because, even though they are not perceived, the object that is merely a wall, a cave, etc., is clearly manifested by direct perception or inference.

original: snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is manifest.

original: gang yang lung log na don ldog go zhes smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang lung log na don ldog go zhes smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: And what was said, ‚ÄúIf the scripture is rejected, the object is rejected,‚Äù is not correct.

original: 'di ltar gal te lung 'jug pa don la ltos na ni ldog par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te lung 'jug pa don la ltos na ni ldog par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Because, if the scripture is engaged in dependence on the object, it is rejected.

original: gang gi phyir lung ni sgra'i bdag nyid yin la /üîΩsgra rnams ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin dngos po las ma 'das par 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung ni sgra'i bdag nyid yin la / sgra rnams ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin dngos po las ma 'das par 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because the scripture has the nature of sound.üîΩAnd the sounds do not engage in the object as it is.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa'i rgyu gang gi phyir sgra de dag las don gyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa'i rgyu gang gi phyir sgra de dag las don gyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because the sounds do not engage in the object as it is, the nature of the object is not ascertained from those sounds.

original: gal te dngos po @219a * //
analyzed: gal te dngos po @219a * //
translated: If thingsüîΩ

original: ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin na ni de las dngos po med par nges par 'gyur na de lta ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin na ni de las dngos po med par nges par 'gyur na de lta ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were to engage in accordance with reality, then it would ascertain the non-existence of the thing, but that is not the case.

original: 'o na de dag ji ltar 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag ji ltar 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: How then does it engage?

original: de dag ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThose‚Äù and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa ni khyad par can gyi don bstan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ni khyad par can gyi don bstan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire to express is the desire to teach the meaning of the qualifier.

original: sgra gang yin pa ni des 'jug pa yin te de'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sgra gang yin pa ni des 'jug pa yin te de'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med pa ste /
translated: The sound is that by which it engages, and therefore there is no error in that.

original: rjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pas na 'di ni rjod par 'dod pa de nyid kyi go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar srid par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pas na 'di ni rjod par 'dod pa de nyid kyi go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar srid par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since it is connected with the desire to express, it is possible to say that this is the means of understanding just that desire to express,

original: dngos po'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the thing.

original: ji ltar brjod par 'dod pa go ba de ltar ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa'i don go phyir te zhes bya ba de ltar bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod par 'dod pa go ba de ltar ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa'i don go phyir te zhes bya ba de ltar bstan zin to //
translated: As for how the desire to express is understood, it has been taught that ‚Äúit is because the meaning of the speaker‚Äôs desire is understood.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du 'o na ni skyes pa'i don la 'khrul pa med pa yin no snyam na skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'o na ni skyes pa'i don la 'khrul pa med pa yin no snyam na skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you think that the meaning of the word is not mistaken, he says, ‚ÄúThe desire of the speaker,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dod pa 'ga' zhig ni don ji lta ba dang 'brel par yang 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'ga' zhig ni don ji lta ba dang 'brel par yang 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Some desires are connected with the meaning as it is.

original: des na thams cad ces khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad ces khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he specifies, ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: don ji ltar ba ste don las ma 'das par 'gyur ba'i dang tshul 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji ltar ba ste don las ma 'das par 'gyur ba'i dang tshul 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning as it is, the meaning that is not exceeded, does not exist in this.

original: 'di snyam du sgra rnams ni me dang du ba bzhin du don dang 'brel pa'i phyir ni de'i go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sgra rnams ni me dang du ba bzhin du don dang 'brel pa'i phyir ni de'i go bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that words are not the understanders of the meaning because they are not connected with the meaning, like fire and smoke,

original: 'on kyang brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa las yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel pa las yin no snyam na /
translated: but rather because of the connection of the expressed and the expresser,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.
