original: de la de'i dang po kho bo la khyad par ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la de'i dang po kho bo la khyad par ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In this regard, there is not the slightest difference between the two of us.

original: don de bshad pa ni de gnyis bye brag brtag par gyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don de bshad pa ni de gnyis bye brag brtag par gyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the meaning is that the two of us should investigate the difference.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni gtam ster ba las kyang rig byed kyi don nges pa gtan la phab pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni gtam ster ba las kyang rig byed kyi don nges pa gtan la phab pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This verse shows that the meaning of the Veda is not ascertained by the method of agreement.

original: de'i phyir rig byed kyi don nges pa ni grags pas gtan la mi phebs shing rigs pas ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed kyi don nges pa ni grags pas gtan la mi phebs shing rigs pas ma yin /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the Veda is not ascertained by reputation, nor by reasoning,

original: gtam ster bas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gtam ster bas kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor by the method of agreement.

original: gzhan yang gal te don nges pa zhig yod na ni de rgyal dpog pas shes nas nye bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te don nges pa zhig yod na ni de rgyal dpog pas shes nas nye bar ston pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if there were a definite meaning, then the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas would know it and teach it.

original: don gcig nyid gsal bar byed pa'i nges pa de nyid gang las yin te /
analyzed: don gcig nyid gsal bar byed pa'i nges pa de nyid gang las yin te /
translated: But how could that very definite meaning that illuminates a single object come from that?

original: ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It could not!

original: brjod par bya ba'i yul thams cad la rung ba'i sgras ni don thams cad brjod par nus pa dang / sgra ni brda'i dbang gis 'jug par mthong ba yin na de ji ltar don gcig la nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i yul thams cad la rung ba'i sgras ni don thams cad brjod par nus pa dang / sgra ni brda'i dbang gis 'jug par mthong ba yin na de ji ltar don gcig la nges par 'gyur /
translated: Since a suitable word can express any object, and since it is seen that a word is applied by the power of convention, how could it be definite in meaning?

original: rig byed la don nges pa yod kyang de shes par ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig byed la don nges pa yod kyang de shes par ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there were a definite meaning in the Vedas, how could it be known?

analyzed: gang las mthong ba nyid kyis don nges par 'gyur ba rig byed kyi sgra la rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the sound of the Vedas does not have the slightest natural difference that would make the meaning definite by being seen.

original: yod kyang mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod kyang mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if it did, it would not be evident.

original: nye bar bstan pa med kyang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa med kyang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would be understood even without being taught.

original: dbang po las 'das pa ni sus kyang shes par nus pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa ni sus kyang shes par nus pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is beyond the senses, it is not possible for anyone to know it.

original: gang gis dbang po las 'das pa de yang shes /
analyzed: gang gis dbang po las 'das pa de yang shes /
translated: But if it is beyond the senses, then how can it be known?

original: 'o na ni 'jig rten pa'i dag la don nges pa med par 'gyur zhing yod kyang shes par nus pa ma yin no zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig rten pa'i dag la don nges pa med par 'gyur zhing yod kyang shes par nus pa ma yin no zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If you say that the meaning is not ascertained for worldly people, or that even if it exists, it is not possible to know it, then we reply:

original: brjod 'dod de brjod par 'dod pa la gnas pa'i don rjod byed ma gtogs par ni nges par byed pa med la /
analyzed: brjod 'dod de brjod par 'dod pa la gnas pa'i don rjod byed ma gtogs par ni nges par byed pa med la /
translated: The meaning that is the basis of the desire to speak is not ascertained except by the expression that is the basis of the desire to speak.

original: shes par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: shes par yang mi nus so //
translated: It is also not possible to know it.

original: brjod par 'dod pa la snang ba'i don brjod na ni brjod par 'dod pa don nges pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa la snang ba'i don brjod na ni brjod par 'dod pa don nges pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: If the meaning that appears to the desire to speak is expressed, then the cause of ascertaining the meaning that is the basis of the desire to speak is the expression.

analyzed: gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i don de nyid brjod bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir don nges pa yin la /
translated: The meaning that is the basis of the desire to speak is ascertained because that very meaning that is the basis of the desire to speak is expressed.

original: don nges pa de'i gsal bar byed pa ni brda yin no //
analyzed: don nges pa de'i gsal bar byed pa ni brda yin no //
translated: The sign that makes that ascertained meaning clear is a convention.

original: byas pa'i lung dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la ni smra bo gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i brjod par bya ba de la brdar byed la /
analyzed: byas pa'i lung dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la ni smra bo gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i brjod par bya ba de la brdar byed la /

original: de dag kyang rang gi slob ma la @231a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi slob ma la @231a * //

original: rtogs par byed pa'i phyir man ngag rgyun ma chad pas nges pa'i don yod par shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i phyir man ngag rgyun ma chad pas nges pa'i don yod par shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since the transmission of this instruction is unbroken, it is known that the definitive meaning exists.

original: don nges par brjod par 'dod pa de ni skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa'i yul la med cing /
analyzed: don nges par brjod par 'dod pa de ni skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa'i yul la med cing /
translated: The object that one wishes to express definitively does not exist in a nonhuman domain.

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i brda'i yang med de /
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i brda'i yang med de /

analyzed: gang las kyang ma yin la shes par yang mi 'gyur ro //

original: sgra'i don ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don ni 'jig rten gyi grags pas gzung ba yin no //

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid nges pas nges pa ni 'ga' yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang brda'i dbang gis yin no //

original: rig byed kyi yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi yang de nyid yin te /

original: des na ci ltar don skyes bus ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: des na ci ltar don skyes bus ma byas pa yin /

original: 'on te ngo bo nyid kyis nges par khas len na /
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo nyid kyis nges par khas len na /

analyzed: de ni mi rigs te 'di ltar sgra rnams ngo bo nyid kyis nges par khas len na /

translated: Therefore, since there is no such intrinsic nature or meaning that is not created by a person, that which is not created by a person is not the definition of scripture.

analyzed: lung gi mtshan nyid gzhan spang ba'i phyir bshad pa /

original: de lung 'di'i phyogs gcig yin par ni grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lung 'di'i phyogs gcig yin par ni grub pa nyid de /
translated: It is established that this is one part of this scriptural passage.

original: 'di ltar smra ba po de'i tshig gang yin pa de'i don de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i don dang ldan pa'i gzhan gang yin pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i don rjod bar byed pa yin pas don gyi sgo nas de'i phyogs gcig tu 'gyur ba yin la /

original: 'di yang rtogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yang rtogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: This is also just a lack of understanding.

original: 'di ltar gal te lung 'di'i ngag 'ga' zhig mi slu bar mthong ba de tsam gyis ci thams cad slu ba ma yin pa dang / mi slu ba yang yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te lung 'di'i ngag 'ga' zhig mi slu bar mthong ba de tsam gyis ci thams cad slu ba ma yin pa dang / mi slu ba yang yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: In this way, if one sees that some statements of scripture are non-deceptive, does that mean that all of them are non-deceptive and not deceptive?

original: 'di ston pa ni ma mthong ba tsam gyi gtan tshigs kyis mi 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir lung de'i mtshan nyid kyi don ni ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ston pa ni ma mthong ba tsam gyi gtan tshigs kyis mi 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir lung de'i mtshan nyid kyi don ni ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the definition of scripture is not ascertained, because the teaching is not established by a reason that is merely not seen.

original: da ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung gi dag rnams rang gi don la 'khrul pa med par bsgrubs pas lung thams cad mi slu ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: da ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung gi dag rnams rang gi don la 'khrul pa med par bsgrubs pas lung thams cad mi slu ba nyid du ston to //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is said,‚Äù he proves that the statements of scripture are non-erroneous with regard to their meaning, and thus shows that all scripture is non-deceptive.

original: sgrar gtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i shugs nyid kyis sgra rnams don dang 'brel pa mi 'khrul pa 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrar gtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i shugs nyid kyis sgra rnams don dang 'brel pa mi 'khrul pa 'grub pa yin te /
translated: The non-erroneous connection of words with their meanings is established by the force of the application of words.

original: snang ba la snang ba'i ngag gi don med na ngag mi sbyor la /
analyzed: snang ba la snang ba'i ngag gi don med na ngag mi sbyor la /
translated: If the meaning of a word that appears in a statement does not exist, the statement is not applied.

original: sgra'i don yang de nyid yin pas de la mi 'khrul pa yin na sgra ji ltar tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: sgra'i don yang de nyid yin pas de la mi 'khrul pa yin na sgra ji ltar tshad ma ma yin /
translated: Since the meaning of the word is just that, if it is non-erroneous with regard to that, how can a word not be a valid cognition?

original: gal te 'di snyam du don de ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du don de ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa yin te /
translated: If you think that this meaning is contradicted by another valid cognition,

original: des na tshad ma ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma yin no snyam na /
translated: and therefore is not a valid cognition,

original: de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir sgra'i don la ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra'i don la ni /
translated: Because with regard to the meaning of a word,

original: tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: another valid cognition does not engage.

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The relation between the action and the agent is not understood by direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ni dngos po tsam 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni dngos po tsam 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Direct perception apprehends just the thing.

original: dngos po rnams ni lcags kyi thur ma ltar 'brel pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni lcags kyi thur ma ltar 'brel pa med pa yin no //
translated: Things are unrelated like an iron scalpel.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Inference also is preceded by direct perception.

original: des na dngos su ma 'brel pa'i ngag gi don la ni mngon @232a * //
analyzed: des na dngos su ma 'brel pa'i ngag gi don la ni mngon @232a * //
translated: Therefore, with regard to the meaning of a word that is not directly related,

original: sum dang rjes su dpag ba 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sum dang rjes su dpag ba 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: direct perception and inference do not engage.

original: des na chu rlung gi dogs na bu ram gyi phung po sbungs pa yod do zhes bya ba dang / sor mo'i rtse mo la glang po che brgya yod do zhes bya ba de lta bu dag la yang dag gi don ni 'ga' zhig gis kyang yul du byed pa 'am /üîΩgnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na chu rlung gi dogs na bu ram gyi phung po sbungs pa yod do zhes bya ba dang / sor mo'i rtse mo la glang po che brgya yod do zhes bya ba de lta bu dag la yang dag gi don ni 'ga' zhig gis kyang yul du byed pa 'am / gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one says, ‚ÄúThere is a lump of molasses in the water,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThere are a hundred elephants on the tip of my finger,‚Äù no one can make the object of that statement an object of experience or deny it.

original: der mngon sum gyi yul la ni gnod pa yin na /
analyzed: der mngon sum gyi yul la ni gnod pa yin na /
translated: If the object of direct perception is not harmed,

original: de'i sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the referent of that statement.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ngag rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i rang gi don la ma 'khrul pa dang mngon sum la sogs pa yang mi 'jug pa na ji ltar tshad ma ma yin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ngag rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i rang gi don la ma 'khrul pa dang mngon sum la sogs pa yang mi 'jug pa na ji ltar tshad ma ma yin pa yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, since statements are not mistaken with regard to their own meaning, which is beyond the senses, and since direct perception and so on do not engage them, how can they not be valid cognitions?

original: de ltar ni rigs mod kyi zhes smos te snang ba la gnas pa brjod pa dang / mngon sum gyis gzung ba rang gi mtshan nyid yul ma yin par gang brjod pa de ni rigs mod kyi 'on kyang mi rigs so zhes smos pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni rigs mod kyi zhes smos te snang ba la gnas pa brjod pa dang / mngon sum gyis gzung ba rang gi mtshan nyid yul ma yin par gang brjod pa de ni rigs mod kyi 'on kyang mi rigs so zhes smos pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHowever‚Äù is stated because although it is reasonable to say that the object of direct perception is the object that appears to it, it is not reasonable to say that the object of direct perception is the object that appears to it.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis don yod par bstan par bya ba de lta bu nyid rab tu grub kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis don yod par bstan par bya ba de lta bu nyid rab tu grub kyang /
translated: Although it is established that the object of direct perception is the object that appears to it,

original: thob pa yin yang sgra sbyor ba ni 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin ba'i phyir don la 'jug pa yang 'dod pas bzlog pa med pas gzhan du don ji lta ba nyid ma yin par yang tha snyad byed pa'i sgra mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thob pa yin yang sgra sbyor ba ni 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin ba'i phyir don la 'jug pa yang 'dod pas bzlog pa med pas gzhan du don ji lta ba nyid ma yin par yang tha snyad byed pa'i sgra mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: the use of terms is related to mere desire, and therefore the engagement of terms in objects is also not averted by desire. Therefore, one sees terms that are used to refer to objects in a way that does not correspond to the object.

original: des na tshad mas gnod pa med kyang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par the tshom za ba nyid ni mi ldog go //
analyzed: des na tshad mas gnod pa med kyang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par the tshom za ba nyid ni mi ldog go //
translated: Therefore, even though it is not undermined by valid knowledge, doubt that the object is not as it appears is not averted.

original: snang ba la gnas pa'i don tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba la gnas pa'i don tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to say that the object that appears is the object of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma ni 'jug par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'jug par byed pa yin na /
translated: If valid knowledge is that which engages,

original: blo la gnas pa'i don la ni su yang mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: blo la gnas pa'i don la ni su yang mi 'jug ste /
translated: then no one engages the object that exists in the mind.

original: de dang snang ba gcig tu byas nas mngon gsum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i don bya ba byed ba'i phyi rol nyid la don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang snang ba gcig tu byas nas mngon gsum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i don bya ba byed ba'i phyi rol nyid la don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Having made the appearance and the object that exists in the mind one, the person who seeks to engage in the functioning of an object that performs a function in the external world engages it by means of direct perception.

original: des na sgra rnams ni zhes pa'i dbang gis don byed pa'i dngos po'i yul can dang tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra rnams ni zhes pa'i dbang gis don byed pa'i dngos po'i yul can dang tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the phrase ‚Äúwords are,‚Äù words are the object of a functioning thing and are valid knowledge.

original: mthong ba bzhin du ma mthong ba'i don la yang sgra ni 'khrul par dogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du ma mthong ba'i don la yang sgra ni 'khrul par dogs pa nyid do //
translated: Just as in the case of seeing, there is doubt that words are mistaken with regard to an object that is not seen.

original: tshul 'dis sgra'i don mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshul 'dis sgra'i don mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: In this way, the object of words is undermined by perception and so on.

original: de'i phyir sgra rnams gang la tshad ma yin pa de la ni slu bar dogs pa yin la ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra rnams gang la tshad ma yin pa de la ni slu bar dogs pa yin la ;
translated: Therefore, with regard to that in which words are valid knowledge, there is doubt that they are deceptive.

original: gang la 'khrul pa med pa'i blo'i don de la ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'khrul pa med pa'i blo'i don de la ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: The object of a nonerroneous awareness is not a valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bus ma byas pa'i lung ni 'ga' yang med pa dang / don dang dngos po'i 'brel pa yang med pa de'i phyir lung log kyang don med la rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bus ma byas pa'i lung ni 'ga' yang med pa dang / don dang dngos po'i 'brel pa yang med pa de'i phyir lung log kyang don med la rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no scripture whatsoever that is not composed by a person, and because there is no relation between the meaning and the words, therefore, even if the scripture is false, the meaning is not understood.

original: kyang gi sgras ni bskal pa'i yul gyi mngon sum dang @232b rjes su dpag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni bskal pa'i yul gyi mngon sum dang @232b rjes su dpag pa yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that even though the object is distant, it is perceived by direct perception and inference.

original: mngon sum log pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum log pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The mere absence of direct perception, due to the absence of direct perception, establishes the convention of nonexistence.

original: gal te mngon sum yang don gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ldog pa don mi ldog go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum yang don gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ldog pa don mi ldog go zhe na /
translated: If you say that because direct perception is the effect of the object, the object does not cease when the direct perception ceases,

original: mngon sum tsam ldog pas ni don ldog par mi smra'i /
analyzed: mngon sum tsam ldog pas ni don ldog par mi smra'i /
translated: we do not say that the object ceases when direct perception alone ceases.

original: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum gang la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yod pa ni don med na de nye bar gnas na med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum gang la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yod pa ni don med na de nye bar gnas na med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the so-called ‚Äúnon-deficiency of the cause‚Äù is that which is directly perceived, and if the object does not exist, it is untenable that it is present without the non-deficiency of the cause.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa gcig la 'du ba'i don gzhan dmigs pa de nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa gcig la 'du ba'i don gzhan dmigs pa de nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When one consciousness observes another object, that itself becomes the non-deficiency of the cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don gzhan dmigs pa de dang de'i rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don gzhan dmigs pa de dang de'i rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one observes another object, it is said that its own nature is not observed.

original: don de ltar gnas pa de la tshu rol mthong bas ni dngos po med pa bsgrub pa la bdag nyid kyi mngon sum log pa tshad mar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: don de ltar gnas pa de la tshu rol mthong bas ni dngos po med pa bsgrub pa la bdag nyid kyi mngon sum log pa tshad mar bya ba yin la /
translated: In that case, for one who sees only a part, in order to establish the non-existence of an entity, one‚Äôs own direct perception must be invalidated.

original: de de ltar tshad mar byed pas ni bdag gi mngon sum ldog pa des gang gzung ba der 'ongs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dgag par rigs so //
analyzed: de de ltar tshad mar byed pas ni bdag gi mngon sum ldog pa des gang gzung ba der 'ongs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dgag par rigs so //
translated: By making that [direct perception] invalid in that way, it is reasonable to negate whatever entity comes to be that which is apprehended by that [direct perception] that has been invalidated.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni thams cad mngon sum gyis gzung bar 'os pa yin pa dang / gzhan thams cad kyi mngon sum log pa ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir tshu rol mthong ba smos so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni thams cad mngon sum gyis gzung bar 'os pa yin pa dang / gzhan thams cad kyi mngon sum log pa ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir tshu rol mthong ba smos so //
translated: The phrase those with limited vision is used because omniscience is suitable to be apprehended by direct perception, and because the direct perception of all others is not established.

original: thams cad ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad ni de lta ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not like that for all.

original: tshu rol mthong bas ni thams cad mngon sum gyis gzung bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas ni thams cad mngon sum gyis gzung bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Those with limited vision are not suitable to apprehend all by direct perception.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad dgag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad dgag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that all things are refuted.

original: de'i phyir de ltar med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can mi dmigs par bshad pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can mi dmigs par bshad pa na /
translated: Therefore, when non-apprehension is explained to have the result of ascertaining non-existence,

original: gzhan gang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa'i mtshan nyid de ci tshad ma ma yin nam snyam pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa'i mtshan nyid de ci tshad ma ma yin nam snyam pa'am /
translated: one might think, Is that which has the characteristic of the reversal of direct perception and inference not a valid means of knowledge?üîΩOr one might think, Is that which has the result of the non-existence of the convention of existence not a valid means of knowledge?

original: bshad pa / bshad zin pa'i mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'jug pa yod pa'i tha snyad med pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / bshad zin pa'i mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'jug pa yod pa'i tha snyad med pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
translated: The response is: That which is different from the non-apprehension that has been explained is apprehension. That which has the result of the non-existence of the convention of existence exists.

original: 'jug pa'i blo sngon can nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i blo sngon can nyid phyir ro //
translated: because it is preceded by the cognition of engagement.

original: dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin te /
translated: The existence of the object is the existence of the existent.

original: de ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the reason for the convention of existence.

original: gang du yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa de med pa der ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyang ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa de med pa der ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyang ldog pa yin te /
translated: Where there is a reason for the convention of existence, when that does not exist there, the convention of existence is also negated,

original: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no reason.

original: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir bskal ba'i yul la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir bskal ba'i yul la zhes smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that very point, he says, ‚Äúin the case of a non-existent object.‚Äù

original: dmigs par mi rung ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par mi rung ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-apprehension of a subject that is not suitable as an object.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ston pa'o //üîΩmi 'jug 'bras can zhes bya ba de rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir yod @233a * //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo ston pa'o // mi 'jug 'bras can zhes bya ba de rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir yod @233a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout direct perception or inference‚Äù shows its nature.

original: pa'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: pa'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to clarify ‚Äúwithout engagement as a result,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúthe cognition of existence,‚Äù and so on.

original: yod pa'i shes pa dang yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / yod ba'i yul len pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa dang yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / yod ba'i yul len pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The cognition of existence, the word ‚Äúexists,‚Äù and the convention of apprehending an existent object, etc.

original: de dag 'gog pa med par nges pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'gog pa med par nges pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
translated: are the effects that definitely exist without being refuted.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad pa / dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba ste rgyu can gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: bshad pa / dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba ste rgyu can gang yin pa dag go //
translated: It is explained: Those that have a prior object, i.e., those that have a cause.

original: dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin te /
translated: The existence of those that have an object is existence.

original: des na de nyid yod pa'i shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad rnams kyi rgyu yin pas de med pa las de dag med do zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid yod pa'i shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad rnams kyi rgyu yin pas de med pa las de dag med do zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since that is the cause of the cognition of existence, the word ‚Äúexists,‚Äù and the convention, it is ascertained that they do not exist if that does not exist.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
translated: The nonobservation that is different from that is the effect of the engagement of the convention of nonexistence.

original: 'jug par bya ba med pa'i tha snyad de'i rgyu mtshan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba med pa'i tha snyad de'i rgyu mtshan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason for the engagement of the convention of nonexistence is seen.

original: snga ma sngar bshad pa ni med pa'i shes pa dang / med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa'i sgra dang / bum pa med par nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dogs pa med par 'ongs pa dang 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i tha snyad de dag 'jug pa'i 'bras bu de nyid gang la yod pa dang /
analyzed: snga ma sngar bshad pa ni med pa'i shes pa dang / med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa'i sgra dang / bum pa med par nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dogs pa med par 'ongs pa dang 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i tha snyad de dag 'jug pa'i 'bras bu de nyid gang la yod pa dang /
translated: The former, as previously explained, is the cognition of non-existence, the sound with the aspect of ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and so forth, and the convention of engagement which is characterized by coming without hesitation preceded by the ascertainment of the non-existence of a pot.

original: yang gi sgras ni yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras can yang yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras can yang yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also the effect of the negation of the convention of existence.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba de dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba de dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to explain the reason for that, it is said:

original: yul bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i sa phyogs rab tu bstan pas rab tu grub pa'i yul can tha snyad sgrub pa'i phyir ro//üîΩtshig le 'ur bya bar ni rgyu mtshan smos pa bya ba la /
analyzed: yul bum pa la sogs pas stong pa'i sa phyogs rab tu bstan pas rab tu grub pa'i yul can tha snyad sgrub pa'i phyir ro// tshig le 'ur bya bar ni rgyu mtshan smos pa bya ba la /
translated: Because the subject is well established by the demonstration of the place empty of the object, the pot and so forth, the convention of establishment is accomplished.üîΩIn the verse, the reason is stated,

original: 'grel par ni yul du smos te /
analyzed: 'grel par ni yul du smos te /
translated: but in the commentary, the object is mentioned.

original: des na 'dis ni gnyi gar yang gnyi ga'i tha snyad bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni gnyi gar yang gnyi ga'i tha snyad bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this teaches that both are to be conventionally expressed in both ways.

original: rgyu mtshan ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The reason is the non-apprehension which has the characteristic of non-apprehension.

original: yul ni bum pas dben pa'i sa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: yul ni bum pas dben pa'i sa bzhi yin no //
translated: The object is the place devoid of pot.

original: gang du med ba'i tha snyad du byed pa der ni yul smos pas /üîΩgnyi ga gzung bar blta ste //
analyzed: gang du med ba'i tha snyad du byed pa der ni yul smos pas / gnyi ga gzung bar blta ste //
translated: Where there is the usage of non-existence, there is the mention of the object.üîΩBoth are to be understood by the mention of the object and the reason.

original: yul nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the object itself.

original: rgyu mtshan smos pas kyang gnyi ga yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan smos pas kyang gnyi ga yin te /
translated: By the mention of the reason, both are to be understood.

original: rgyu mtshan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the reason itself.

original: yang gi sgra'i don ston pa ni gnyi ga yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du ni 'dra bar bshad do //
analyzed: yang gi sgra'i don ston pa ni gnyi ga yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du ni 'dra bar bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is explained as having the same result, the negation of the usage of both existence and non-existence.

original: rang zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúown‚Äù is taken to mean the nature of the usage of existence.

original: bzlog pa ni 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'gal ba ste /
translated: The opposite is the contradictory,

original: med pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: the usage of non-existence.

original: de dag gi rgyu dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs pa de gnyis go rims bzhin du med pa dang yod pa'i rgyu des na 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs pa de gnyis go rims bzhin du med pa dang yod pa'i rgyu des na 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The reason for those is that the objective referent and the non-apprehension of the objective referent are, respectively, the cause of non-existence and the cause of existence.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: tha snyad kyi rgya @233b mtshan dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rgya @233b mtshan dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa rnams kyi yod pa yin no //
translated: The objective referent itself is the cause of the conventional existence of existent things.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa la ni med do //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa log pa la ni med do //
translated: It is not the case that the opposite of direct perception and inference is non-existent.

original: des na rgyu med pa'i phyir de'i yod pa'i tha snyad ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu med pa'i phyir de'i yod pa'i tha snyad ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of a cause, the conventional existence of that is eliminated.

original: cig shos la ni yod pa'i tha snyad dang 'gal ba med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba zhugs pa ni cig shos ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos la ni yod pa'i tha snyad dang 'gal ba med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba zhugs pa ni cig shos ldog pa yin no //
translated: In the other case, the conventional existence of the opposite is not eliminated because the cause of the conventional existence of the opposite is not eliminated.

original: gal te de las blo ldog pa yin yang ci de tsam gyis don yang ldog gam /
analyzed: gal te de las blo ldog pa yin yang ci de tsam gyis don yang ldog gam /
translated: Even if the mind is eliminated from that, is the object also eliminated just by that?

original: ldog na ni dmigs pa tsam go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog na ni dmigs pa tsam go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is, then the mere objective referent would be the cause of understanding.

original: ci ste don mi ldog na ni de'i tha snyad kyi ci ltar ldog ce na /
analyzed: ci ste don mi ldog na ni de'i tha snyad kyi ci ltar ldog ce na /
translated: But if the object is not eliminated, how is the conventional existence of that eliminated?

original: bshad pa / ldog pa cam gyis mi dmigs pa gcig la ni yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / ldog pa cam gyis mi dmigs pa gcig la ni yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: In the case of nonobservation of a mere absence, there is doubt about existence.

original: des na nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tha snyad ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tha snyad ldog pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the convention of existence is reversed on the basis of certainty.

original: the tshom za ba'i yod pa'i tha snyad ni mi ldog go //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i yod pa'i tha snyad ni mi ldog go //
translated: The convention of existence that is doubted is not reversed.

original: gzhan snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan snang ba mi dmigs pa la ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of the nonobservation of something else, it is reversed.

original: the tshom las bzlog pa ni nges pa yin te /üîΩde'i phyir the tshom dang nges pa'i yod pa'i tha snyad ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom las bzlog pa ni nges pa yin te / de'i phyir the tshom dang nges pa'i yod pa'i tha snyad ldog pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of doubt is certainty.üîΩTherefore, the convention of existence that is doubted and the convention of existence that is certain are reversed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs snga ma dag gis ni yod pa'i tha snyad gnyi ga yang dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs snga ma dag gis ni yod pa'i tha snyad gnyi ga yang dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin la /
translated: Thus, the former reasons have the effect of refuting both conventions of existence.

original: gtan tshigs phyi ma dag gis ni yod pa'i tha snyad gnyis kyi khyad par 'gog par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs phyi ma dag gis ni yod pa'i tha snyad gnyis kyi khyad par 'gog par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The latter reasons explain how the distinction between the two conventions of existence is refuted.

original: gcig la ni the tshom za ba'i phyir nges pa nyid kyi yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig la ni the tshom za ba'i phyir nges pa nyid kyi yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa yin la /
translated: In the case of the former, the convention of existence that is certain is refuted because there is doubt.

original: gzhan las ni yod pa'i tha snyad mtha' dag 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las ni yod pa'i tha snyad mtha' dag 'gog pa yin te /
translated: But in the other, all conventions of existence are refuted,

original: med pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the ascertainment of nonexistence.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i mi dmigs pa gnyis pa de la gnyis pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid tsam gyi dmigs pa tsam gyi yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir tshad mar bshad do //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i mi dmigs pa gnyis pa de la gnyis pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid tsam gyi dmigs pa tsam gyi yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir tshad mar bshad do //
translated: The second nonapprehension just explained is explained to be a valid cognition, because it is necessary to refute the mere convention of existence, the mere object of the reversed characteristic.

original: 'o na de gang la tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang la tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: Well, in regard to what is it not a valid cognition?

original: ldog pa med pa mthong ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa mthong ba nges pa'o //
translated: It is the ascertainment of the seeing of the nonexistence of the reversed.

original: de las sogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan can sgra dang tha snyad gang yin pa de la nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las sogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan can sgra dang tha snyad gang yin pa de la nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not applied to that sound and convention which has that as its reason, etc.,

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
translated: because of doubt.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med par nges pa mi skyed pa des na tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med par nges pa mi skyed pa des na tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not generate the ascertainment of the nonexistence of the thing, therefore it is not a valid cognition.

original: nye bar mi sbyor ba nyid sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa shes par byed pa'i yan lag ma nges pa'i mi dmigs ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi sbyor ba nyid sgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa shes par byed pa'i yan lag ma nges pa'i mi dmigs ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: In order to prove that it is not applied, it is explained that it is the nonapprehension of the uncertain branch of the proof.

original: mi 'khrul pa ni rtags thams cad kyi yan lag yin na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa ni rtags thams cad kyi yan lag yin na /
translated: Non-deception is a part of all inferential marks.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di la ni mi 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di la ni mi 'khrul pa med de /
translated: But non-apprehension does not have non-deception,

original: des na de las rtogs pa ma yin no //üîΩdang po snang ba mi dmigs pa ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de las rtogs pa ma yin no // dang po snang ba mi dmigs pa ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: therefore it is not a means of valid cognition.

original: nges pa'i @234a * //
analyzed: nges pa'i @234a * //
translated: The first, the non-apprehension of the manifest, is a means of valid cognition,

original: 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang la yod pa'o //
translated: because it is the cause of ascertainment.üîΩIt is the cause of ascertainment of the non-existence of the manifest.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is said as follows:

original: mi dmigs pa dang po ni dngos po med pa nges par byed pas tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang po ni dngos po med pa nges par byed pas tshad ma yin no //
translated: The first non-apprehension is a means of valid cognition because it ascertains the non-existence of an entity.

original: tshad ma ni 'jug par byed pa nyid la brjod la /
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'jug par byed pa nyid la brjod la /
translated: A means of valid cognition is said to be that which engages,

original: 'jug par byed pa yang nges pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yang nges pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: and engagement is based on ascertainment.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang bum pa med par nges par byed pa yin pas bum pa don du gnyer ba ldog par byed pa dang / bum pa med pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa ni bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang bum pa med par nges par byed pa yin pas bum pa don du gnyer ba ldog par byed pa dang / bum pa med pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the manifest is a means of valid cognition because it ascertains the absence of a pot in a place devoid of a pot, and thus it causes one who seeks a pot to desist, and it causes a person who seeks the absence of a pot to engage.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni nges par byed pa ma yin pas na don gang la yang skyes bu 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni nges par byed pa ma yin pas na don gang la yang skyes bu 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension of the non-appearing is not a determiner, and therefore it does not cause a person to engage in any object.

original: nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod pa'i tha snyad ni 'gog par byed kyi /
analyzed: nges pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yod pa'i tha snyad ni 'gog par byed kyi /
translated: It does refute the convention of existence that is preceded by determination.

original: the tshom sngon du 'gro ba'i tha snyad ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom sngon du 'gro ba'i tha snyad ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not refute the convention that is preceded by doubt.

original: des na the tshom las kyang 'jug pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na the tshom las kyang 'jug pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, engagement does exist even from doubt.

original: de'i tshad ma nyid ni nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog par nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshad ma nyid ni nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog par nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its validity is ascertained because it is the cause of the refutation of the convention of existence that is preceded by determination.

original: mi dmigs pa bshad nas rang bzhin bshad pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa bshad nas rang bzhin bshad pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Having explained non-apprehension, in order to explain nature, it is said:

original: bdag nyid ngo bo nyid kyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid ngo bo nyid kyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no //
translated: That which is a reason of intrinsic nature is a nature.

original: khyad par ci lta bu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of distinction does it have?

original: bshad pa sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod pa de'i dngos po nyid de kho na tsam gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod pa de'i dngos po nyid de kho na tsam gyi /
translated: It is said: That which is the mere existence of the entity of that which is the property to be established.

original: de yod tsam dang rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: de yod tsam dang rjes 'brel can //
translated: It is the nature of that which is concomitant with and has only that as its object.

original: mi gnyis par rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i yin no //üîΩci'i phyir / de yod tsam dang rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: mi gnyis par rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i yin no // ci'i phyir / de yod tsam dang rjes 'brel can //
translated: The nature of that which is concomitant with and has only that as its object is the nature of that which is non-different from that.

original: zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Why is it said to be ‚Äúconcomitant with and has only that as its object‚Äù?

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no zhes de tsam zhig mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin yin no zhes de tsam zhig mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said that ‚Äúthe reason that has the nature of that is the nature of that‚Äù?

original: don gyi de'i bdag nyid ces smos so //
analyzed: don gyi de'i bdag nyid ces smos so //
translated: The meaning is that it has the nature of that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos de'i'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos de'i'o //
translated: The property that is to be established has the nature of that, and the property that is the reason has that nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid du gyur pa la 'thad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can nyid du gyur pa la 'thad pa yin gyi /
translated: It is tenable that the nature of that is concomitant with and has only that as its object.

original: don gzhan dang 'brel pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan dang 'brel pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not related to a different object.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir khyad par nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the distinction is stated.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod na yang yod par ma gyur pa grub par ma gyur pa phyis 'byung ba la ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi de'i bdag nyid rang bzhin nyid gang yin pa de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod na yang yod par ma gyur pa grub par ma gyur pa phyis 'byung ba la ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi de'i bdag nyid rang bzhin nyid gang yin pa de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the establishing property exists, then that which does not exist, that which is not established, that which occurs later, is not of the nature of the establishing property.

original: phyis grub pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ci ltar sngar grub pa'i rang bzhin @234b yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis grub pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ci ltar sngar grub pa'i rang bzhin @234b yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is called ‚Äúestablished later‚Äù be the nature of that which is established earlier?

original: de ltar rtog na ni sngar grub pa bdag nyid med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rtog na ni sngar grub pa bdag nyid med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: If you imagine it that way, then that which is established earlier would not have an established nature.

original: des na grub pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na grub pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it is established.

original: gzhan yang tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, difference is the connection of contradictory properties.

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pas gcig par mi 'thad do //
translated: And establishment and non-establishment are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive. Therefore, it is not tenable that they are the same.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Moreover, the difference of things is preceded by the difference of their causes.

original: gang zhig sngar skyes pa dang / phyis rgyu gzhan gyis skyed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag gal te tha mi dad pa yin na 'o na gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gang zhig sngar skyes pa dang / phyis rgyu gzhan gyis skyed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag gal te tha mi dad pa yin na 'o na gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: If those that arise earlier and are later generated by other causes are not different, then how could they be different?

original: de na 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su 'byung ba dag tha dad pa yin pas de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de na 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su 'byung ba dag tha dad pa yin pas de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since they possess contradictory properties and have different causes, they arise at different times, earlier and later, and therefore they are not of the same nature.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid ma yin mod /
translated: If they are not of the same nature,

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por ni 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por ni 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then they are the basis of the act of understanding and the act of that which is to be understood.

original: rgyu rnams kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang zhes smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe causes also . . .‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos grub pa na phyis rgyu gzhan las 'grub pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos ni 'bras bur 'gyur grang na ;
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos grub pa na phyis rgyu gzhan las 'grub pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos ni 'bras bur 'gyur grang na ;
translated: If the property to be established is established later from other causes, then it becomes the effect.

original: rgyu rnams kyang gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyang gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But the causes do not necessarily possess an effect.

original: des na 'bras bu la 'khrul pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir phyis rgyu gzhan las 'grub pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu la 'khrul pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir phyis rgyu gzhan las 'grub pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, because of error with respect to the effect, the entity that is the object of understanding and the entity that is the means of understanding do not exist.

original: de'i go bar bya ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba de yang yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni rang bzhin dang go bar byed pa yang yin te /üîΩdes na de yod tsam dang rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: de'i go bar bya ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba de yang yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni rang bzhin dang go bar byed pa yang yin te / des na de yod tsam dang rjes 'brel can //
translated: Because it is established later from another cause, it is not that nature and it is not the object of understanding of that. Therefore, that probandum is merely existent and is related to the reason, which is nature and the means of understanding.

original: zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: Therefore, it is qualified as ‚Äúmerely existent and related.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin de yang rang gi bdag nyid gtan tshigs nyid du sgras nye bar 'god pa na khyad par ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang rang gi bdag nyid gtan tshigs nyid du sgras nye bar 'god pa na khyad par ni bye brag ste /
translated: Moreover, when that nature is itself posited as the reason by means of the term, the qualification is the distinction.

original: de la ltos ba nye bar 'god pa'am /
analyzed: de la ltos ba nye bar 'god pa'am /
translated: It is posited in dependence on that.

translated: If it were not so, the entity of the pervaded and the pervader would not exist. This is what is being taught.

original: de ltar bstan pa 'dis ni chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa can dag gis gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis kyi go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid gang yin pa de'i mchan nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa 'dis ni chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa can dag gis gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis kyi go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid gang yin pa de'i mchan nyid kyang ngo //
translated: This teaching shows that the reason, which is both similar and dissimilar, is the means of understanding and the object of understanding.

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byad pa nyid @236b kyi rgyu ni thams cad kyang khyab pa nges pa yin pas na /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byad pa nyid @236b kyi rgyu ni thams cad kyang khyab pa nges pa yin pas na /
translated: The cause of being the means of understanding and the object of understanding is the ascertainment of the pervasion.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu mtshan te /
translated: The definition of that is the reason.

original: khyab pa nges pa yin no //üîΩgal te tshul gsum pa'i rjes su zhugs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs gcig nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyab pa nges pa yin no // gal te tshul gsum pa'i rjes su zhugs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs gcig nyid ma yin nam /
translated: The ascertainment of the pervasion is the reason.

original: gang las rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang las rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the reason that is engaged in the three modes is not the same as the one that has the connection of being the same nature, from what are the two types?

original: bshad pa / sbyor ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: bshad pa / sbyor ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: It is said: By the power of application.

original: sbyor ba ni sgra brjod pa'i byed pa ste dngos su brjod pa'i nus pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sgra brjod pa'i byed pa ste dngos su brjod pa'i nus pas so //
translated: Application is the activity of expressing the word; by the power of direct expression.

original: de las gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de las gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: From that, there are two types of reasons.

original: dag kha cig la ni sgrub pa dngos kyi brjod bya kha cig la ni dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: dag kha cig la ni sgrub pa dngos kyi brjod bya kha cig la ni dgag pa yin no //
translated: In some cases, the thesis is an affirmation; in some cases, it is a negation.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis ni brjod bya tha dad pa las yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis ni brjod bya tha dad pa las yin no //
translated: Of these two, the two kinds of reason are distinguished on the basis of the difference in the content of the thesis.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyu de nyid ston par byed de ;
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyu de nyid ston par byed de ;
translated: The same author shows the cause of the two kinds of reason:

original: dpe'i chos can dang bsgrub bya'i chos mi mthun pa nyid 'di la yod pa'o //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can dang bsgrub bya'i chos mi mthun pa nyid 'di la yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason based on non-observation has the property of the dissimilar example, but not the reason based on observation.‚Äù

original: chos mi mthun pa yang sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa yang sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyis byas pa'o //
translated: The reason based on observation is also made by the property of the thesis.

original: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin la sgra yang byas ba yin no zhes byas ba nyid kyis byas bas chos can gnyis chos mthun pa can yin la /
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin la sgra yang byas ba yin no zhes byas ba nyid kyis byas bas chos can gnyis chos mthun pa can yin la /
translated: That which is produced is impermanent, and sound is produced. Thus, by being produced, the two subjects have the property in common.

original: gang rtag pa de ni ma byas pa yin la ;
analyzed: gang rtag pa de ni ma byas pa yin la ;
translated: That which is permanent is not produced.

original: sgra ni byas pa yin no zhes 'di dag gi chos mi mthun pa yang byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni byas pa yin no zhes 'di dag gi chos mi mthun pa yang byas pa yin no //
translated: Sound is produced. Thus, the property of these two is not in common.

original: gang la brjod par bya ba chos mthun pa yod pa /
analyzed: gang la brjod par bya ba chos mthun pa yod pa /
translated: That which has the property in common as the content is

original: de ni chos mthun pa can yin la /
analyzed: de ni chos mthun pa can yin la /
translated: the reason based on observation.

original: gzhan ni chos mi mthun pa can no //
analyzed: gzhan ni chos mi mthun pa can no //
translated: The other is the reason based on non-observation.

original: gal te gang du chos mthun pa can yin pa der ni rjes su 'gro bar brjod bya yin la /
analyzed: gal te gang du chos mthun pa can yin pa der ni rjes su 'gro bar brjod bya yin la /
translated: If it is the same in every case where the property is similar, then it is called the forward mode.

original: gang du chos mi mthun pa der ni ldog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang du chos mi mthun pa der ni ldog pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if it is different in every case where the property is dissimilar, then it is called the reverse mode.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshul 'ga' zhig kho na brjod pa'i phyir gnyi gas tshul gsum ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshul 'ga' zhig kho na brjod pa'i phyir gnyi gas tshul gsum ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one of them expresses only one mode, neither of them expresses the three modes.

original: des na sbyor ba'i bye brag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: des na sbyor ba'i bye brag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, not only is there a difference in their application,

original: don gyi bye brag kyang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi bye brag kyang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but there is also a difference in their meaning.

original: 'di gnyis don du ni bye brag ci yang med do zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis don du ni bye brag ci yang med do zhes smos so //
translated: These two are not different in meaning.

original: don gang gi dbang du byas nas dag gnyis rab tu sbyar ba'i dgos par 'gyur ba de ni 'dir don du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don gang gi dbang du byas nas dag gnyis rab tu sbyar ba'i dgos par 'gyur ba de ni 'dir don du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning in terms of which the two are applied is their purpose.

original: brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the meaning here, but it is not the content.

original: de'i phyir ngag 'di gnyis kyi don la na bye brag ci yang med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag 'di gnyis kyi don la na bye brag ci yang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference in the meaning of these two statements,

original: gnyi ga yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are applied in terms of a reason that has three modes.

original: gal te 'o na ni 'di gnyis kyi rtogs par bya ba'i don la khyad par cung zad kyang med na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ni 'di gnyis kyi rtogs par bya ba'i don la khyad par cung zad kyang med na /
translated: If there is not the slightest difference between the objects of comprehension of these two,

original: rjod par byed pa'i bya ba la khyad par yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i bya ba la khyad par yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be no difference in the function of the expression.

original: de ni de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Because that is the object of that.

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma rtogs par zhes smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag ma rtogs par zhes smos so //
translated: In response to this qualm, it says, ‚ÄúWithout understanding the distinction of application.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rjod par byed pa'i byed pa las ni khyad par yod pa nyid do //üîΩgo bar bya @237a * //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i byed pa las ni khyad par yod pa nyid do // go bar bya @237a * //
translated: There is a difference in the function of the expression.

original: ba'i don las khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: ba'i don las khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference in the object of comprehension.

original: gang zhig dngos su brjod par bya ba de nyid rtogs par bya bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos su brjod par bya ba de nyid rtogs par bya bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin na /
translated: That which is directly expressed is not the object of comprehension.

original: gang gis rjod par byed pa'i byed pa tha dad pas dngos po tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis rjod par byed pa'i byed pa tha dad pas dngos po tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would there be a difference in the thing due to a difference in the function of the expression?

original: 'on kyang dngos su brjod par bya ba ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos su brjod par bya ba ni gzhan yin la /
translated: However, that which is directly expressed is one thing.

original: rtogs par bya ba yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba yang gzhan yin te /
translated: That which is comprehended is another.

original: dper na lha sbyin tshon po nyin par zan mi za'o zhes zos pa'i 'bras bu tshon po nyid ngag gis dngos su brjod cing khyad par can gyi dus kyang bkag pa na /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin tshon po nyin par zan mi za'o zhes zos pa'i 'bras bu tshon po nyid ngag gis dngos su brjod cing khyad par can gyi dus kyang bkag pa na /
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúFat Devadatta does not eat during the day,‚Äù the result of eating, namely, fatness, is directly expressed, and when the time is specified,

original: don gyis mtshan mo za bar nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don gyis mtshan mo za bar nges pa bzhin no //
translated: it is understood by implication that he eats at night.

original: des na 'dir brjod par bya ba gzhan yin la /
analyzed: des na 'dir brjod par bya ba gzhan yin la /
translated: Therefore, here the expressed meaning is one thing,

original: rtogs par bya ba yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba yang gzhan yin no //
translated: but what is understood is something else.

original: rtogs par byed pa de yang mtshan mo bla'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis kyang rtogs par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa de yang mtshan mo bla'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis kyang rtogs par nus pa yin no //
translated: And that which is understood is also fatness, and the word ‚Äúat night‚Äù is also capable of conveying that.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang dag gnyis kyi brjod par bya ba ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang dag gnyis kyi brjod par bya ba ni gzhan yin la /
translated: In the same way, here the expressed meaning of the two realities is one thing,

original: rtogs par bya ba yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba yang gzhan yin no //
translated: but what is understood is something else.

original: des na gnyi gas kyang don gcig kho na rtogs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na gnyi gas kyang don gcig kho na rtogs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, both of them understand only one thing.

original: gal te 'di snyam du sgra'i byed pa la brten pa'i khyad par ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du sgra'i byed pa la brten pa'i khyad par ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If you think that the specification based on the function of the word is not to be expressed in an inference for the sake of others,

original: ci ltar 'dir brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dir brjod ce na /
translated: How is this explained?

original: bshad pa / sbyor ba de mthong ba goms pa las rang nyid rtogs pa na yang ste /üîΩgzhan las rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rang rtogs pa na yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / sbyor ba de mthong ba goms pa las rang nyid rtogs pa na yang ste / gzhan las rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rang rtogs pa na yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Response: When one realizes that by seeing the application, it is like that even when one realizes it oneself.

original: bsgrub pa'i sgo nas sam dgag pa'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i sgo nas sam dgag pa'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang gtan tshigs kyi dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Not only does one realize it from another, but when one realizes it oneself, it is like that because one realizes it through affirmation or through negation. Therefore, the division of the reason is also taught in inference for oneself.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ji ltar gzhan rtogs pa la dbye ba nye bar mkho ba de bzhin du bdag nyid rtogs pa la yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan rtogs pa la dbye ba nye bar mkho ba de bzhin du bdag nyid rtogs pa la yang yin te /
translated: Just as the division is necessary for realizing it for another, so it is also for realizing it for oneself.

original: des na rang gi don du yang srid pa'i phyir 'di nyid du dbye bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi don du yang srid pa'i phyir 'di nyid du dbye bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is possible even for oneself, the division is made here.

original: gal te gang gi rtags kyi tshul gsum brjod par 'gyur ba rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa na ldog pa rtogs par ci ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa dang / bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te gang gi rtags kyi tshul gsum brjod par 'gyur ba rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa na ldog pa rtogs par ci ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa dang / bshad pa /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWhen the forward pervasion is stated, how does the reverse pervasion come to be understood?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir brjod par bya ba chos mthun pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba la yang don gyis te /üîΩshugs kyis chos mi mthun pa nyid rtogs pa yod pa yin no //üîΩshugs de nyid ston par byed pa ni ldog pa rtogs pa'i blo de med na bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod par bya ba chos mthun pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba la yang don gyis te / shugs kyis chos mi mthun pa nyid rtogs pa yod pa yin no // shugs de nyid ston par byed pa ni ldog pa rtogs pa'i blo de med na bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the way that the meaning of the reason is such that it also has a property that is not common to both the reason and the predicate.üîΩThe following passage shows that very same point: ‚ÄúIf there were no cognition of the counter-pervasion, then the reason would not pervade the predicate.‚Äù

original: ldog pa'i blo med na yang sgra las rjes su 'gro ba yang nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldog pa'i blo med na yang sgra las rjes su 'gro ba yang nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that if there were no cognition of the counter-pervasion, then one would not ascertain the pervasion of the reason by the predicate.

original: 'di ltar @237b bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang 'ga' zhig nyid las ldog pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar @237b bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang 'ga' zhig nyid las ldog pa na /
translated: In this way, when a certain property that is the predicate of the proposition is seen to be absent from a locus,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos mi ldog par dogs pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dang bral bar dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos mi ldog par dogs pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dang bral bar dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: there is a doubt that the property that is the reason is not absent from that locus. That very doubt is also a doubt that the property that is the reason is absent from the property that is the predicate of the proposition.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba'i ngag gis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs na ldog pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba'i ngag gis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs na ldog pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore, if one understands the positive concomitance by means of a positive statement, one also understands the negative concomitance.

original: de ltar ma yin na rjes su 'gro ba nyid ni mi rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rjes su 'gro ba nyid ni mi rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then one would not understand the positive concomitance.

original: de bzhin du don gyis chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don gyis chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, in the case of a negative statement, one understands the negative concomitance.

original: de med na zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ste /
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa med na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ste /
translated: If one does not understand the negative concomitance, then one doubts the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum,

original: log pa la gtan tshigs med par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa la gtan tshigs med par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason is absent in the dissimilar instances.

original: yul gang na gtan tshigs yod pa na bsgrub bya yod par the tshom za ba de nyid las bsgrub bya log pa na sgrub par byed pa log par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gang na gtan tshigs yod pa na bsgrub bya yod par the tshom za ba de nyid las bsgrub bya log pa na sgrub par byed pa log par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One doubts that if the probandum is absent in the place where the reason is present, then the reason is absent in the absence of the probandum.

original: de'i phyir log pa'i tshig gis ldog par rtogs pa na rjes su 'gro ba yang rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir log pa'i tshig gis ldog par rtogs pa na rjes su 'gro ba yang rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, when one understands the negative concomitance by means of a negative statement, one also understands the positive concomitance.

original: de lta ma yin na ldog pa de nyid la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ldog pa de nyid la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then one would doubt whether the mere negation is the same as the negation of the object.

original: gal te nam mkha' la mnyan par bya ba nyid dang mi rtags pa nyid ldog cing mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyang de las ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la mnyan par bya ba nyid dang mi rtags pa nyid ldog cing mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyang de las ldog pa yin na /
translated: If the object of hearing and the impermanent are negated in space, and the object of visual perception is also negated in space,

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni yod du zin kyang mi rtag pa nyid dang mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni yod du zin kyang mi rtag pa nyid dang mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then even though the object of hearing exists, the impermanent and the object of visual perception do not exist.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: So, isn‚Äôt it the case that the negation does not pervade the positive?

original: 'di ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur te don 'di 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur te don 'di 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later, and this point will be explained.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis chos gcig ldog pa na chos gzhan ldog par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis chos gcig ldog pa na chos gzhan ldog par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mere non-observation of one thing negates another thing.

original: 'on kyang de dag 'brel pa yod na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag 'brel pa yod na yin no //
translated: However, if they are related, then it is so.

original: des na gcig log pas gzhan ldog par rtogs par byed pa ni de dag gis 'brel ba tshad mas rtogs par bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na gcig log pas gzhan ldog par rtogs par byed pa ni de dag gis 'brel ba tshad mas rtogs par bya ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the understanding that the negation of one thing negates another is the understanding of their relation by means of a valid cognition.

original: /'brel ba nges pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin te /
analyzed: /'brel ba nges pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of the relation is the ascertainment of the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i ldog pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i ldog pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore, there is no reversal that lacks pervasion.

original: 'di dag la ni rjes su 'gro ba med cing ldog pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni rjes su 'gro ba med cing ldog pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these [reasons] lack pervasion and reversal.

original: gang la chos 'di dag bsam par bya ba'i gtan tshigs de gnyis kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la chos 'di dag bsam par bya ba'i gtan tshigs de gnyis kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the logical reason for which these properties are to be considered?

original: bshad pa / rab tu sbyar bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs de dag kyang cung zad byas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon byed kyi tshul gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / rab tu sbyar bar bya ba'i gtan tshigs de dag kyang cung zad byas pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon byed kyi tshul gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: It is said: Those logical reasons that are to be applied are also slightly produced. This teaches the logical reason in the manner of an indicator.

original: de thams cad mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba mtshon bya'i tshul gyis bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba mtshon bya'i tshul gyis bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
translated: All of that is impermanent. This teaches the probandum in the manner of the indicated.

original: thams cad smos pa ni nges par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni nges par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of all is for the sake of certainty.

original: de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste de ni mi rtag @238a * //
analyzed: de thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste de ni mi rtag @238a * //
translated: All of that is impermanent. That is impermanent.

original: pa kho na'o zhes gang la kho na'i sgras byas pa de las gzhan nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir byas pa nyid dang btsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la nges pa yin no //
analyzed: pa kho na'o zhes gang la kho na'i sgras byas pa de las gzhan nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir byas pa nyid dang btsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la nges pa yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni phyogs ni gdon mi za bar bstan par mi bya ba yin no //

analyzed: des na phyogs ni sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no //
