analyzed: byas ba de med na med pa nyid ldog pa dang / gang gi tshe sgra la yang yod par bdog par bstan pa ste 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan to //

analyzed: 'di ltar de ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: For example, impermanence does not cease due to the cessation of arising that occurs immediately after being sought, because it exists as having a nature that is not arising that occurs immediately after being sought.üîΩSince a phenomenon does not cease due to the cessation of something else that is not its object of ascertainment, having ascertained a reason that has the nature of that object of ascertainment by means of a valid means of knowledge, one should state that the phenomenon ceases due to the cessation of something else that is different from it.

analyzed: gal te @239b 'jig pa'i ngang can 'jig pa yin par 'dod pa yin na yang /
translated: Even if you assert that the state of having the nature of disintegration is disintegration,

original: de ni tha dad pa ma yin zhing tha mi dad pa yang bya bar mi nus so //üîΩgang yang ji ltar skyed par byed pa yod na mngon par 'dus byas pa med kyang /
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa ma yin zhing tha mi dad pa yang bya bar mi nus so // gang yang ji ltar skyed par byed pa yod na mngon par 'dus byas pa med kyang /
translated: it is not different, and it is not possible that what is not different is an action.

original: dngos po skye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dngos po skye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de bzhin du /
translated: And if you say that when there is a cause of production, there is only the production of a thing, even though there is no manifest activity,üîΩand likewise, when the cause of cessation is near, there is only the cessation of a thing,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye na dngos po ldog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes smras pa de ni rnam par dpyad dgos so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye na dngos po ldog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes smras pa de ni rnam par dpyad dgos so //
translated: then that must be analyzed.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu rnams ni dngos po med pa'i nye bar 'jog pa po'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu rnams ni dngos po med pa'i nye bar 'jog pa po'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The causes of production are the nature of the positors of non-things.

original: dngos po med pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa cung zad med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa cung zad med do //
translated: But there is no activity whatsoever in a nonthing.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams ni yod par rnam par gnas pa'i zlog par byed pa yin pas de la ni gdon mi za bar dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams ni yod par rnam par gnas pa'i zlog par byed pa yin pas de la ni gdon mi za bar dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Since the causes of cessation are established as the reversers of endurance, it is definitely necessary to analyze them.

original: ci dngos po yod pa de rang gi rgyu dag las ldog pa'i chos kyi ngo bor skyes sam /
analyzed: ci dngos po yod pa de rang gi rgyu dag las ldog pa'i chos kyi ngo bor skyes sam /
translated: Do those existent things arise from their own causes as having the nature of a phenomenon that is reversible?

original: 'on te mi ldog pa'i chos su yin gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni /üîΩldog pa'i chos nyid kyi rang nyid ldog par 'gyur gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu la ldog pa dang bcas pa'i ldog pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'on te mi ldog pa'i chos su yin gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni / ldog pa'i chos nyid kyi rang nyid ldog par 'gyur gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu la ldog pa dang bcas pa'i ldog pa nyid ni /
translated: Or are they irreversible phenomena? If it is the first possibility,üîΩthen it is correct to say that the nature of a phenomenon that is reversible would itself be reversible.

original: dngos po'i rgyu dag gis bskyed par mi rigs so zhes brjod par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu dag gis bskyed par mi rigs so zhes brjod par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is not correct that the causes of things generate a reversible phenomenon that is accompanied by reversal.

original: 'di ltar ci srid 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba de srid du ni gnas pa'i chos yin te mi gnas pa'i chos nyid yin na ni snga ma nyid du ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ci srid 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba de srid du ni gnas pa'i chos yin te mi gnas pa'i chos nyid yin na ni snga ma nyid du ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as the causes of cessation are not proximate, it is a phenomenon that endures. If it were a phenomenon that does not endure, it follows that it would have ceased earlier.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba'i dus su yang dus cung zad gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa skad cig ma ngang por gnas pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba'i dus su yang dus cung zad gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa skad cig ma ngang por gnas pa de nyid yin te /
translated: Even at the time when the cause of cessation is near, the nature of remaining for a little while is the same as the original moment of remaining.

original: des na ldog pa zlog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na ldog pa zlog pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, cessation is not reversed.

original: de ni dus cung zad cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus cung zad cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it remains for a little while.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas log pa ni 'ga' yang dngos po'i rgyus bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas log pa ni 'ga' yang dngos po'i rgyus bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the cause of cessation, nothing is produced by the cause of a thing.

original: ci ste de'i ngo bo mi ldog pa'i chos nyid yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyus kyang bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: ci ste de'i ngo bo mi ldog pa'i chos nyid yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyus kyang bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: But if its nature is the reality of non-cessation, then the cause of cessation cannot reverse it.

original: de ltar dngos po skye ba la ni skyed par byed pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po skye ba la ni skyed par byed pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, in regard to the arising of a thing, there is no conception whatsoever that depends on a cause of arising.

original: skye ba ni med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising is not non-existent.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni ldog par byed pa ma yin no zhes bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni ldog par byed pa ma yin no zhes bsgrubs pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is established that a cause of cessation does not cause even the slightest thing, it does not cause cessation.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag kyang dngos po la cung zad mi byed pa bkag na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ston pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yan lag yongs su sbyang ba'i don du 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag kyang dngos po la cung zad mi byed pa bkag na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ston pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yan lag yongs su sbyang ba'i don du 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: The refutation of the fact that cooperative conditions do not perform any function with regard to things is shown by the refutation of the fact that they do not perform any function.

original: gzhan yang 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par grub pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is established that destruction has a cause.

original: rim dan cig car gyis don mi byed pa mi 'thad pa nyid kyis @240a * //
analyzed: rim dan cig car gyis don mi byed pa mi 'thad pa nyid kyis @240a * //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it does not perform a function either sequentially or non-sequentially,

original: bsgrub par mi nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgrub par mi nus par 'gyur te /
translated: it cannot be established.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa ni la lar res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir rim dang rim ma yin pa'i stobs kyis skad cig nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa ni la lar res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir rim dang rim ma yin pa'i stobs kyis skad cig nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since destruction that has a cause sometimes occurs in some places, it does not follow that it is momentary due to the power of sequence or non-sequence.

original: de'i phyir yang 'di ni gnod par byed pa yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'di ni gnod par byed pa yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore this is the purification of the refutation.

original: yang gang gi rgyu med pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu ma nges pa nyid la brjod pa de'i tshe ni 'di nyid gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar 'god par blta bar byas te /
analyzed: yang gang gi rgyu med pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu ma nges pa nyid la brjod pa de'i tshe ni 'di nyid gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar 'god par blta bar byas te /
translated: Moreover, when you say that the cause of its nonexistence is the uncertain cause of its destruction, then at that time, this very [reason] should be regarded as the valid cognition that refutes [your position].

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu 'ga' la yang nges pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu 'ga' la yang nges pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when the nature of destruction is not ascertained as any cause whatsoever,

original: gang skye ba de thams cad 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang skye ba de thams cad 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then whatever arises will all be of the nature of destruction.

original: dngos po 'jig pa las yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa ni skad cig mar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa las yang rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa ni skad cig mar grub pa yin no //
translated: The destruction of things does not depend on any other cause, and this is established as momentary.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yan lag gam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yan lag gam /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the part of the valid cognition that refutes [your position]

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar nye bar bkod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar nye bar bkod pa nyid yin no //
translated: is itself the presentation of the valid cognition that refutes [your position].

original: de la re zhig gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yan lag nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'chad pa ni dngos po'i 'jig pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yan lag nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'chad pa ni dngos po'i 'jig pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, first, the reason that establishes the part of the valid cognition that refutes [your position] is stated: The destruction of things does not depend on any other cause, and this is established as momentary.

original: de'i ngo bo te 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi rang gi ngo bor ni rang gi ngo bo skyed par byed pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo te 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi rang gi ngo bor ni rang gi ngo bo skyed par byed pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The entity of that, i.e., the entity that has the nature of cessation, does not depend on a cause other than the one that produces its own entity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las 'jig pa'i ngang can ldog pa'i chos nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las 'jig pa'i ngang can ldog pa'i chos nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from its own cause with the nature of cessation.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin nyid ni ltos pa med pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa'i ngang tshul gyi rang bzhin nyid ni ltos pa med pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since the very nature of the entities that have the nature of cessation is independent,

original: gang cung zad byas pa de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin no //
analyzed: gang cung zad byas pa de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin no //
translated: whatever is produced is by its very nature something that has the nature of cessation.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang can du mthong ba nyid ni yang gzhan gyis de ltar byed pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang can du mthong ba nyid ni yang gzhan gyis de ltar byed pa ma yin na //
translated: Since it is seen to have the nature of cessation, it is not the case that it is made that way by something else.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa 'di nyid kyi phyir ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa 'di nyid kyi phyir ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This very absence of a cause of cessation will be demonstrated.

original: de ni gang dag gis 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nges par khas len pa de dag gis rgyu med par khas blangs dgos so zhes ltos pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni zhes bya bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ni gang dag gis 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nges par khas len pa de dag gis rgyu med par khas blangs dgos so zhes ltos pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni zhes bya bar ston par byed do //
translated: That is, those who definitely assert that the intrinsic reality of cessation must assert that it is without a cause.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams nges par 'gyur ba med par mthong ba de'i phyir na dngos po 'jig pa'i ngang can ni ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams nges par 'gyur ba med par mthong ba de'i phyir na dngos po 'jig pa'i ngang can ni ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause things that are dependent‚Äù indicates that things that are dependent are seen to be definitely without cessation. Therefore, things that have the nature of cessation are not dependent.

original: rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i nang nas 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i nang nas 'ga' zhig rtag pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: If they were dependent on a cause, then some things such as a vase would be permanent.

original: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because causes are not definitely required to initiate an effect.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu gcig tu zad na ni nye ba la 'khrul par dogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu gcig tu zad na ni nye ba la 'khrul par dogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the cause of cessation were limited to one, then it would be possible to doubt that it is near.

original: gang gi phyir thob la @240b sogs pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu rnam pa mang po yod pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thob la @240b sogs pa'i 'jig pa'i rgyu rnam pa mang po yod pas na /
translated: But because there are many types of causes of cessation, such as obtaining and so on,

original: gdon mi za bar de dag 'ga' zhig 'jig pa nye bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de dag 'ga' zhig 'jig pa nye bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that some of them will be destroyed.

original: gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes smos so //
translated: If you say that it is not certain,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu mang ba de ltar ni bden te /üîΩgal te 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po yod kyang de dag kyang so sor rang gi rkyen dang 'brel pas nye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu mang ba de ltar ni bden te / gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po yod kyang de dag kyang so sor rang gi rkyen dang 'brel pas nye ba yin la /
translated: it is true that there are many causes of destruction.üîΩBut even though there are many causes of destruction, they are not all present at the same time, because each is related to its own conditions.

original: de dag nye bar yang res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu 'jig pa'i rgyu dag kyang gdon mi za bar nye ba ma yin bas 'ga' zhig mi 'jig bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nye bar yang res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu 'jig pa'i rgyu dag kyang gdon mi za bar nye ba ma yin bas 'ga' zhig mi 'jig bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And even when they are present, they do not necessarily produce their effect, destruction, so some things are not destroyed.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is being explained:

original: ma tshang ba dang gegs byed pa de dag srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba dang gegs byed pa de dag srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible for causes to be incomplete or obstructed.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig tshogs pa tsam dang 'brel pa de ni rgyu ma tshang bas mi skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig tshogs pa tsam dang 'brel pa de ni rgyu ma tshang bas mi skyed pa yin te /
translated: Any effect that is related to the mere assemblage of causes is not produced when the causes are incomplete.

original: dper na sa bon gyi myu gu skye ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par dang po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon gyi myu gu skye ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par dang po bzhin no //
translated: For example, a sprout does not arise from a seed when the conditions for its arising are absent, as in the case of a seed that is burned or rotten.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig tshogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa de ni tshogs pa yod kyang gegs byed pa srid pa las mi skye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig tshogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa de ni tshogs pa yod kyang gegs byed pa srid pa las mi skye ba yin te /
translated: That effect which depends on the transformation of the assemblage does not arise from the assemblage, even though it exists, because of the possibility of obstruction.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i myu gu sa bon la sogs pa yod na yang 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig tu skyes bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i myu gu sa bon la sogs pa yod na yang 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig tu skyes bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a sprout which depends on the transformation of a seed, etc. does not arise from a seed, etc. even though it exists, because of the possibility of obstruction.

original: rgyu rnams 'bras bu la 'khrul bar bstan pa des ni /
analyzed: rgyu rnams 'bras bu la 'khrul bar bstan pa des ni /
translated: By this demonstration that causes are in error with regard to their effect,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po thams cad kyang 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po thams cad kyang 'khrul pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is explained that all the many causes of destruction are in error.

original: ci'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they in error?

original: 'bras gnas med pa'i phyir te ma nges pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras gnas med pa'i phyir te ma nges pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: Because they are not certain, because the effect does not exist.

original: 'khrul pa'i nye ba gang dag la brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i nye ba gang dag la brjod ce na /
translated: To whom is this error imputed?

original: gang dag 'jig brgyu dang bcas par smra ba'i rgol ba de dag la 'khrul pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig brgyu dang bcas par smra ba'i rgol ba de dag la 'khrul pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: To those disputants who maintain that there are causes of destruction, the fault of error is imputed to them.

original: gnag gi phyir 'jig pa rgyu med pa yin pa de'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can ldog pa'i chos de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba la ldog pa med par 'gyur ba ni de'i ngo bor ldog pa'i chos su nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gnag gi phyir 'jig pa rgyu med pa yin pa de'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can ldog pa'i chos de'i ngo bor 'gyur ba la ldog pa med par 'gyur ba ni de'i ngo bor ldog pa'i chos su nges pa yin no //
translated: Because of the darkness, destruction is causeless. Therefore, the state of destruction, the phenomenon of cessation, would not revert to its original state. That which is certain to revert to its original state is a phenomenon that definitely ceases.

original: tshad ma'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is this:

original: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba la ltos pa med pa de ni de'i ngo bor nges pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba la ltos pa med pa de ni de'i ngo bor nges pa yin na /
translated: If something does not depend on becoming a certain nature, then it is certain to be that nature.

original: gal te ltos pa med kyang dus dang yul dang gnas skabs gzhan la ltos nas 'jig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa med kyang dus dang yul dang gnas skabs gzhan la ltos nas 'jig pa yin na /
translated: If, even though it does not depend, it is destroyed in dependence on another time, place, or occasion,

original: de yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yul dang dus dang gnas skabs gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it depends on another time, place, or occasion, its independence is undermined.

original: des na gal te skad cig gnas kyang dus gzhan la ltos pas na ltos pa med pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te skad cig gnas kyang dus gzhan la ltos pas na ltos pa med pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it endures for a moment, but in dependence on another time, its independence is clearly undermined.

original: des na skad cig tsam gnas na yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ltos pa med pa nyid dang 'gal ba nye bar dmigs @241a * //
analyzed: des na skad cig tsam gnas na yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ltos pa med pa nyid dang 'gal ba nye bar dmigs @241a * //
translated: Therefore, if it endures for even a moment, it would be related to another. Thus it is observed that it is contradictory to be unrelated.

original: pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is observed that it is contradictory for it to be independent, it is the opposite of the position that it is independent.

original: skad cig tsam gnas nas ltos pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skad cig tsam gnas nas ltos pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does it not become independent after remaining for just an instant,

original: 'on kyang dngos po la ldog pa'i chos nyid srid par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po la ldog pa'i chos nyid srid par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but also it is not possible for a thing to have the nature of cessation.

original: 'di ltar skad cig tsam du gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig tsam du gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: In this way, the nature of remaining for just an instant

original: skad cig gi mthar thug pa na yang mi ldog pas yang skad cig gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gi mthar thug pa na yang mi ldog pas yang skad cig gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: does not cease at the end of the instant, and so it remains for another instant.

original: des na skad cig tsam du gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni nam yang mi ldog pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas par thal lo //
analyzed: des na skad cig tsam du gnas pa'i rang bzhin ni nam yang mi ldog pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of remaining for just an instant never ceases, it follows that it remains forever.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ldog pa'i chos yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ldog pa'i chos yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, if a thing has the nature of cessation,

original: skad cig tsam du gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig tsam du gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it does not remain for even an instant.

analyzed: gang gi phyir gegs byed pa mi srid pa ni de nyid yin no //

original: nus pa dang mi nus pa de dag kyang rgyu nus pa dang / mi nus pa shes pa la yin te /
analyzed: nus pa dang mi nus pa de dag kyang rgyu nus pa dang / mi nus pa shes pa la yin te /
translated: And the knowledge of the potential and the nonpotential is in the knowledge of the potential and nonpotential causes.

original: des na 'bras bu phan tshun gyi rang bzhin gyis rgyu nus pa nges par brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu phan tshun gyi rang bzhin gyis rgyu nus pa nges par brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the potential cause is said to be ascertained by the nature of the effect.

original: 'bras bu ma mthong bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma mthong bar ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the effect is not seen.

original: gal te 'di snyam du rang bzhin gyi dbye ba rgyus byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du rang bzhin gyi dbye ba rgyus byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that the division of natures is not created by the cause,

original: 'on kyang ltos pa nyid kyi dngos po rnams 'ga' zhig ni rang bzhin ni de 'dra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang ltos pa nyid kyi dngos po rnams 'ga' zhig ni rang bzhin ni de 'dra bar 'gyur la /
translated: However, in the case of things that are dependent, some are like that.üîΩ

original: gzhan ni gzhan du snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan du snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But, you might say, some things, in virtue of their dependence, have such a nature, while others have a different nature.üîΩWe reply:

original: don rnams kyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: don rnams kyi zhes smos so //
translated: The nature of things is not definite.

original: glo bur zhes bya ba ni yul la lar dang / rgyu la ltos pa med pa ni yul la lar dang / dus 'ga' zhig tu dang / s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa'i rdzas 'ga' zhig la s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin nges par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: glo bur zhes bya ba ni yul la lar dang / rgyu la ltos pa med pa ni yul la lar dang / dus 'ga' zhig tu dang / s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa'i rdzas 'ga' zhig la s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin nges par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The nature of some things, in some places, in dependence on some causes, at some times, and in some substances, such as rice seeds, is not definite with respect to the production of some effects, such as rice sprouts.

original: 'on kyang de lta mod kyi srid phyir thams cad thams cad kyi che thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta mod kyi srid phyir thams cad thams cad kyi che thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: But, you might say, it is possible that all things, in all ways, would be all things.

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba 'di la yang rgyu gang gis 'di dga' zhig 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du skye bar 'gyur bar rang bzhin nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba 'di la yang rgyu gang gis 'di dga' zhig 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du skye bar 'gyur bar rang bzhin nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig brjod dgos so //
translated: In the same way, in this classification of things as perishable or imperishable, you must state some cause for the definiteness of their natures, so that some things are produced as perishable by nature.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag gis nges pa'i rgyu mdzub tshugs su bstan par mi nus kyang de lta mod kyi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag gis nges pa'i rgyu mdzub tshugs su bstan par mi nus kyang de lta mod kyi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not say that we cannot point to the cause of ascertainment, but we do say that it is possible.

original: khyab pa mi 'grub po snyam na /
analyzed: khyab pa mi 'grub po snyam na /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúAlthough we cannot point to a definite cause, still, it is possible.üîΩ‚Äù

original: bshad pa / 'jig rten 'dir 'jig pa'i ngo bo nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'jig rten 'dir 'jig pa'i ngo bo nges par byed pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: We reply, there is no certainty that the world has an end.

original: mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is impossible.

original: skye ba can skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni ste /
analyzed: skye ba can skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad ni ste /
translated: All things that arise have the nature of arising.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni 'jig pa dang ldan pa 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni 'jig pa dang ldan pa 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: All things that are established have the nature of being destroyed.

original: mthong ba'i phyir 'jig pa ni rgyu nges pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir 'jig pa ni rgyu nges pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that destruction does not have a definite cause, because it is seen.

original: 'di snyam du 'jig pa'i rang bzhin rgyu nges pa can ma yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'jig pa'i rang bzhin rgyu nges pa can ma yin du chug mod /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúAlthough the nature of destruction does not have a definite cause,

original: rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not without a cause.

original: des na gang skye ba de dag ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du @243a * //
analyzed: des na gang skye ba de dag ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du @243a * //
translated: Therefore, all things that arise have the nature of being destroyed.

original: 'gyur gyi / gzugs la sogs pa gang dag mi skye ba da dag ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur gyi / gzugs la sogs pa gang dag mi skye ba da dag ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But they do not become the nature of destruction.

original: de'i phyir skye ba can gyi rang bzhin nyid 'jig pa dang ldan gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pha rol po dogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba can gyi rang bzhin nyid 'jig pa dang ldan gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pha rol po dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, only that which has the nature of arising has destruction, not anything else.üîΩIn response to the opponent‚Äôs doubt, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states,

original: de'i skye ba ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i skye ba ni zhes smos te /
translated: Its arising . . .

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i dbang gis dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba ma yin pa de'i phyir skye ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i dbang gis dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba ma yin pa de'i phyir skye ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Since the nature of things does not arise by the power of arising, therefore arising is not the cause of destruction.

original: rgyu med kyang rang bzhin nges pa nyid yin no zhe na rgyu med pa la yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: rgyu med kyang rang bzhin nges pa nyid yin no zhe na rgyu med pa la yang zhes smos so //
translated: If you say that even without a cause, its nature is determined, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states, Even without a cause . . .

original: de la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point of this is as follows.

original: rgyu dang bral ba ma skyes pa rnams ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges par mi rung ba'i phyir nges pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba ma skyes pa rnams ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges par mi rung ba'i phyir nges pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since those that are not arisen due to being devoid of a cause are not suitable as determined in terms of place, time, and nature, they do not have any determined nature.

original: de'i phyir na gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i rang gi ngo bo ci 'dra ba ni rgyu med par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i rang gi ngo bo ci 'dra ba ni rgyu med par mi 'thad la /
translated: Therefore, the intrinsic reality of seeing form and so on is untenable without a cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan par mthong ba gang yin pa de thams cad kyang 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa ni rgyu la nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan par mthong ba gang yin pa de thams cad kyang 'jig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa ni rgyu la nges pa ma yin la /
translated: Since all that is seen possesses a cause and that which is seen is also impermanent, the impermanence of things such as form is not ascertained by a cause.

original: rgyu nges pa med pa can gyi 'jig pa yang rgyu med par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nges pa med pa can gyi 'jig pa yang rgyu med par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Impermanence that does not have a definite cause is said to be without a cause.

original: des na gang cung zad skyed par byed pa de thams cad ni 'jig pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang cung zad skyed par byed pa de thams cad ni 'jig pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever generates something, all that generates impermanence.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i dngos po 'di la rgyu'i zhes bya ba skyed par byed pa'i 'jig pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa skyed pa'i skyed pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i dngos po 'di la rgyu'i zhes bya ba skyed par byed pa'i 'jig pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa skyed pa'i skyed pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba 'ga' yang med la /
translated: Therefore, this impermanent thing does not have a cause that is called a generator, since there is no intrinsic difference between that which generates impermanence and that which generates that which is not impermanent.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba de med pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par dbye ba de med pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is no such division in the nature of the cause, the effect would not be divided into that which is destroyed and that which is not destroyed.

original: des na mi mtshungs so //üîΩji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon dang nas kyi sa bon dag phan tshun gyi myu gu bskyed pa'i nus pa med par rang gi rgyus byas par mthong ba'i rgyu'i nus pa tha dad par ston pa de bzhin du gang zhig rgyu tha dad par rjes su dpag par
analyzed: des na mi mtshungs so // ji ltar s'a lu'i sa bon dang nas kyi sa bon dag phan tshun gyi myu gu bskyed pa'i nus pa med par rang gi rgyus byas par mthong ba'i rgyu'i nus pa tha dad par ston pa de bzhin du gang zhig rgyu tha dad par rjes su dpag par
translated: Therefore, they are not similar.

original: 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as the rice seed and barley seed are seen to be produced by their own causes, which are different in that they lack the ability to produce each other‚Äôs sprouts, in the same way, that which is inferred to have different causes, form and so on, is not seen to have the nature of that which is destroyed and that which is not destroyed.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du mthong ba'i 'jig pa nyid ni rgyu tha dad par rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin pa des na s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dang mi mtshungs so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du mthong ba'i 'jig pa nyid ni rgyu tha dad par rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin pa des na s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa dang mi mtshungs so ;
translated: Therefore, the mere seeing of destruction in all cases does not cause the inference of different causes. Therefore, they are not similar to rice seeds and so on.

original: / gal te de lta na yang mthong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa 'ga' zhig ni mi 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gal te de lta na yang mthong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po gzugs la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang bcas pa 'ga' zhig ni mi 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then a thing that is different from the visible form, etc., and that has a cause that is completely heterogeneous with visible form, etc., would not be destroyed.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: kho bo cag gis de mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis de mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not see it.

original: srid par dogs pas na khyab pa ni @243b nyams par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gal te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: srid par dogs pas na khyab pa ni @243b nyams par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gal te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: If you say that the pervasion is lost because of the possibility of its existence, then we reply:

original: tshogs pa las skye ba gang yin pa thams cad ni nges pa med pa ste nges par mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa las skye ba gang yin pa thams cad ni nges pa med pa ste nges par mi nus pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is produced from a collection is not certain, i.e., it cannot be ascertained.

original: mthong ba'i tshogs pa can ni 'jig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i tshogs pa can ni 'jig pa yin gyi /
translated: The collection that is seen is destroyed.

original: tshogs pa mthong ba med pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa mthong ba med pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes smras pa ni /
translated: It is not another collection that is not seen.

original: tshogs pa de dag mthong ba gang las ma lus par gyur pa'i mthong ba de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa de dag mthong ba gang las ma lus par gyur pa'i mthong ba de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not see that collection from which there is no possibility of anything remaining.

original: 'bras bu thams cad mthong ba med pa'i phyir na mthong ba med pa'i rnam par skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa mi 'jig pa skyed pa ni mi mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad mthong ba med pa'i phyir na mthong ba med pa'i rnam par skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa mi 'jig pa skyed pa ni mi mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because no effect is seen, the assembly that generates the non-disintegration of a non-ceased assembly is not seen.

original: 'di snyam du gal te tshogs pa 'ga' zhig mi 'jig pa skyed par 'gyur na ni mthong ba'i tshogs pa rnams las kyang 'ga' zhig mi 'jig pa skyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te tshogs pa 'ga' zhig mi 'jig pa skyed par 'gyur na ni mthong ba'i tshogs pa rnams las kyang 'ga' zhig mi 'jig pa skyed par 'gyur na /
translated: If some assembly generates the non-disintegration of some assembly, then some non-disintegration would be generated from seen assemblies.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba yang mi 'jig pa ni 'ga' yang mi skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba yang mi 'jig pa ni 'ga' yang mi skyed do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even the unseen does not generate any non-disintegration.

original: smras pa tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni nus pa sna tshogs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: smras pa tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni nus pa sna tshogs par mthong ngo //
translated: We say that those assemblies are seen to have various potencies.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa nus pa sna tshogs pa de la ji ltar gzugs skyed pa'i tshogs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa skyed par byed par nus pa yin yang 'ga' zhig thogs pa med pa'i dngos po skyed pa'i nus pa yang yod pa de bzhin du phal cher
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa nus pa sna tshogs pa de la ji ltar gzugs skyed pa'i tshogs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa skyed par byed par nus pa yin yang 'ga' zhig thogs pa med pa'i dngos po skyed pa'i nus pa yang yod pa de bzhin du phal cher
translated: Therefore, in the case of a variety of potential collections, even though the collection that produces form is capable of producing form, some collections are capable of producing nonobstructive things, and likewise,

original: 'jig pa skyed par nus pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'jig pa skyed par nus pa yin yang /
translated: most are capable of producing disintegration.

original: 'ga' zhig ni mi 'jig pa skyed par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni mi 'jig pa skyed par 'gyur ro ;
translated: But some are capable of producing nondisintegration.

original: / rnam pa thams cad du tshogs pa dang gzhan 'gog par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir na khyab pa ma grub po zhe na /üîΩre zhig rgyu nges pa med pa can gyi 'jig pa de nyid ni yul thams cad la sgrub par nus par mkhyen nas /
analyzed: / rnam pa thams cad du tshogs pa dang gzhan 'gog par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir na khyab pa ma grub po zhe na / re zhig rgyu nges pa med pa can gyi 'jig pa de nyid ni yul thams cad la sgrub par nus par mkhyen nas /
translated: Since there is no logical argument that can refute the collection and other factors, your pervasion is not established.üîΩYou may think that it is possible to prove that disintegration is not caused in all contexts, but we do not say that disintegration is not caused in all contexts.

original: gnod par byed pa rim pa dang cig car 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa rim pa dang cig car 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
translated: We say that it is not tenable to posit that disintegration is caused by something other than itself.

original: 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid ni tshad ma 'di nyid yongs su sbyang ba'i don du gnyer ba bkod par rang sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid ni tshad ma 'di nyid yongs su sbyang ba'i don du gnyer ba bkod par rang sngar bshad zin te /
translated: The nonexistence of a cause of destruction has already been explained above, in order to make the meaning of this very valid cognition thoroughly pure.

original: rgyu tsam dang 'brel pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la ni sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tsam dang 'brel pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la ni sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to establish the nature of destruction as merely related to a cause.

original: don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPurpose‚Äù means ‚Äúneed.‚Äù

original: de byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo accomplish‚Äù means ‚Äúto bring about.‚Äù

original: der nus pa mthu ste /
analyzed: der nus pa mthu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCapacity‚Äù means ‚Äúpower.‚Äù

original: dngos po gang la mtshan nyid de rang bzhin de yod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang la mtshan nyid de rang bzhin de yod pa'o //
translated: That which has that characteristic, that nature, is a thing.

original: yang ci'i phyir nus pa nyid dngos po yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir nus pa nyid dngos po yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why is capacity itself a thing?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir thams cad nus pa der brjod pa ni bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir thams cad nus pa der brjod pa ni bsnyad pa ste /
translated: It is explained: Because everything is said to be in that capacity.

original: de dang bral ba mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de /
analyzed: de dang bral ba mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de /
translated: That which is devoid of that, which has the characteristic of non-possession,

original: 'bras bu bya ba'i rgyu mtshan du @244a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu bya ba'i rgyu mtshan du @244a * //
translated: is said to be the reason for the effect, the action.

original: bsnyad ba dang bral ba ni nye bar brjod pa med pa ste dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyad ba dang bral ba ni nye bar brjod pa med pa ste dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: That which is devoid of expression, which is without expression, is non-existent.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig bya ba byed pa de ni dngos po yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig bya ba byed pa de ni dngos po yin na /
translated: Therefore, that which performs an action is a thing.

original: gal te de ltar mtha' zhes bya ba dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus kyi sems kyi skad cig tha mar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mtha' zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mtha' zhes bya ba dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus kyi sems kyi skad cig tha mar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mtha' zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: If the final moment of mind of an arhat who has attained nirvana is called an ‚Äúextreme,‚Äù

original: skad cig de nye bar brjod pa med pa zhes bya ba dngos po med par thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig de nye bar brjod pa med pa zhes bya ba dngos po med par thal lo zhe na /
translated: then it follows that the final moment of mind would be a non-thing, that is, it would be inexpressible.

original: ma yin te zhes smos te /üîΩsems can zhes bya bar bgrangs pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes smos te / sems can zhes bya bar bgrangs pa ste /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúNo!‚ÄùüîΩThe nature of the mind that is counted as a sentient being

original: grangs su bgrang zhing rnam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi skad cig gzhan gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrangs pa yin la /
analyzed: grangs su bgrang zhing rnam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi skad cig gzhan gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrangs pa yin la /
translated: is the nature of the mind that is counted and posited as a sentient being.

original: de'i nye bar len pa ni mtha' gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa ni mtha' gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The appropriation of that is characterized by an extreme.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it is a co-originating cause, it is a thing.

original: nye bar len pa las byung ba med pa'i phyir mtha' nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar len pa las byung ba med pa'i phyir mtha' nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it does not arise from appropriation, it is an extreme. This is the meaning of the text.

original: da ni mtha' skad cig khams gsum du 'bras bu gang la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ston par byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni mtha' skad cig khams gsum du 'bras bu gang la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ston par byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Now, in order to show which result in the three realms is the effect that is co-produced with the final moment, he says:

original: tha ni zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i don te nus pa'i yul 'di ni chung ste 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tsam mo //
analyzed: tha ni zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i don te nus pa'i yul 'di ni chung ste 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tsam mo //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù means ‚Äúsmall.‚Äù The domain of ability is small, namely, just the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata.

original: shes bya khyab par byed pas na khyab pa ste shes bya khyab pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de la'o //
analyzed: shes bya khyab par byed pas na khyab pa ste shes bya khyab pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de la'o //
translated: Because it pervades the knowable, it is pervasive. That wisdom of the TathƒÅgata pervades the knowable.

original: gzugs dang bral ba'i gzugs med pa'i khams su yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pa bskyed pa la ni mtha'i skad cig nus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang bral ba'i gzugs med pa'i khams su yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pa bskyed pa la ni mtha'i skad cig nus pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even in the formless realm, which is devoid of form, the knowledge of the TathƒÅgata is able to generate that.

original: khams 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su ni du ma la phan 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su ni du ma la phan 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In the desire realm and the form realm, it becomes beneficial to many.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i lus kyi bya ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i gzhan gyi sems shes pa la rgyu'i dngos po nyid kyis phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i lus kyi bya ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i gzhan gyi sems shes pa la rgyu'i dngos po nyid kyis phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: It benefits by the very fact of its being a cause for the bodily actions that exist in one's own mental continuum and for the knowledge of the minds of others that exists in the mental continuums of others.

original: gal te 'di snyam du gzugs med pa'i khams su bcom ldan 'das sgrim pa med pa na ste gdul bya'i rgyud la gzigs par bzhed pa mi mnga' ba ni sems kyi rgyud skad cig tha ma nus par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du gzugs med pa'i khams su bcom ldan 'das sgrim pa med pa na ste gdul bya'i rgyud la gzigs par bzhed pa mi mnga' ba ni sems kyi rgyud skad cig tha ma nus par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one thinks that the Bhagavat, in the formless realm, is not concentrated, that is, does not wish to look at the mental continuums of those to be trained, then the mental continuum of the last moment would not be able to.

original: ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: The reply is: No.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: bsgrim pa med pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrim pa med pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible that he is not concentrated.

original: ji ltar mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi srid ce na /
translated: How is it impossible?

original: gzhan gyi don la 'jug cing spyod pa de la sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la 'jug cing spyod pa de la sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that he would engage in and practice for the sake of others without the perfection of the means of accomplishment.

original: sgrub par byed pa ste yongs su grub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa ma nyams pa de mi 'thad pa'i @244b phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ste yongs su grub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa ma nyams pa de mi 'thad pa'i @244b phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that he would not have the perfection of the means of accomplishment, the perfection of the means of complete accomplishment, without deficiency or loss.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'thad ce na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa de'i yan lag ma tshang bas so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa de'i yan lag ma tshang bas so //
translated: Because the means of accomplishment is incomplete, since a part of it is missing.

original: bsgrim pa med na ni bsgrub pa'i yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrim pa med na ni bsgrub pa'i yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no exertion, the means of accomplishment is incomplete.

original: ci'i phyir ma tshang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma tshang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it incomplete?

original: sems can rnams kyi bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa spang bya dang blang bya dag gi rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa spang bya dang blang bya dag gi rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-understanding of the actions and non-actions of sentient beings, i.e., of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: bsgrim pa med na spang bya dang blang bya dag mi rtogs la /
analyzed: bsgrim pa med na spang bya dang blang bya dag mi rtogs la /
translated: If there is no exertion, there is no understanding of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: rtogs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa yin no //
translated: And understanding is the means of accomplishment that is not incomplete.

original: ji ltar na mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtogs she na /
translated: How is there no understanding?

original: chos gcig yongs su ma shes na yang ngo //
analyzed: chos gcig yongs su ma shes na yang ngo //
translated: Even if one thing is not fully understood.

original: bsgrim pa med na ni mang po shes par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsgrim pa med na ni mang po shes par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If there is no exertion, many things are not understood.

original: gcig yongs sum shes na yang bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig yongs sum shes na yang bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one thing is not fully understood, then actions and non-actions are not understood.

original: ji ltar gcig yongs su ma shes na mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig yongs su ma shes na mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: How is it that if one thing is not fully understood, there is no understanding?

original: thams cad du blang bya dang spang byar the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du blang bya dang spang byar the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because doubt arises as to what is to be done and what is not to be done in all cases.

original: ji ltar gcig ma shes pa thams cad la the tshom skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig ma shes pa thams cad la the tshom skye zhe na /
translated: How does doubt arise in all cases if one case is not known?

original: bya ba 'am bya ba ma yin pa thams cad la ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba dngos su 'am brgyud pas thams cad nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ro //üîΩma shes pa'i dngos po gcig po de ni dngos su 'am brgyud pas gdon mi za bar sems can nam /
analyzed: bya ba 'am bya ba ma yin pa thams cad la ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba dngos su 'am brgyud pas thams cad nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ro // ma shes pa'i dngos po gcig po de ni dngos su 'am brgyud pas gdon mi za bar sems can nam /
translated: Because all that is to be done or not to be done is directly or indirectly included in that one case.

original: sems can gyi don 'ga' zhig gi gnod par byed pa yin pa des na spang bar bya ba ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi don 'ga' zhig gi gnod par byed pa yin pa des na spang bar bya ba ma yin pa 'am /
translated: That one thing which is not known directly or indirectly harms some sentient being or some purpose of sentient beings.üîΩTherefore, it is not to be abandoned.

original: sems can gyi don gzhan 'ga' zhig la ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa des na blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gzhan 'ga' zhig la ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pa des na blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, it benefits some other sentient being or some purpose of sentient beings. Therefore, it is to be adopted.

original: de'i phyir de yongs su ma shes na ni thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba yin pa des na thams cad shes pa ni bsgrim pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yongs su ma shes na ni thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba med pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba yin pa des na thams cad shes pa ni bsgrim pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if it is not fully understood, the means of accomplishing omniscience is incomplete, and thus omniscience is accompanied by exertion.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni thams cad kyi tshe gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa nyid do //üîΩrtag tu bsgrim pa med du zin kyang tha ma dngos po med pa nyid du ni thal ba med do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni thams cad kyi tshe gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa nyid do // rtag tu bsgrim pa med du zin kyang tha ma dngos po med pa nyid du ni thal ba med do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of an omniscient one always has the formless realm as its object.üîΩEven though it is always accompanied by exertion, it is not the case that the final moment is necessarily nonexistent.

original: tha ma nus pa med pa nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tha ma nus pa med pa nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The final moment is not nonexistent.

original: nus pa med pa nyid ces bya bar nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa med pa nyid ces bya bar nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that it is nonexistent.

original: bsgrim pa'i dus su 'byung ba'i tha ma 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrim pa'i dus su 'byung ba'i tha ma 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because some final moments that occur at the time of exertion produce effects.

original: mi byed kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ni 'bras bu mi byed na yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang bral bas mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: mi byed kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ni 'bras bu mi byed na yang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang bral bas mi nus pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it does not act‚Äù means that even though the effect does not act, it is powerless because it is devoid of the cooperative conditions.

original: gcig pus skyed pa ni 'ga' yang khas mi len te /
analyzed: gcig pus skyed pa ni 'ga' yang khas mi len te /
translated: No one accepts that it is produced by a single cause.

original: des na rkyen dang bral bas mi byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na rkyen dang bral bas mi byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it does not act because it is devoid of conditions.

original: rkyen dang ma bral na ni nus pa'i phyir byed pa nyid do //üîΩgal @245a * //
analyzed: rkyen dang ma bral na ni nus pa'i phyir byed pa nyid do // gal @245a * //
translated: But if it is not devoid of conditions, it does act because it is powerful.

original: de skad cig ma ma yin pa yang tha ma bzhin du lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas 'bras bu byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de skad cig ma ma yin pa yang tha ma bzhin du lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas 'bras bu byed do zhe na /
translated: Even if it is not momentary, it produces an effect in dependence on the cooperative conditions, like the final moment.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar 'dir tha ma'i sems kyi skad cig lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang ma bral na lhan cig tu bya ba byed nus pa de bzhin du skad cig ma ma yin pa lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa na byed pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar 'dir tha ma'i sems kyi skad cig lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang ma bral na lhan cig tu bya ba byed nus pa de bzhin du skad cig ma ma yin pa lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa na byed pa
translated: Why? Because just as the final moment of consciousness is able to act in dependence on the cooperative conditions, in the same way, if the nonmomentary is dependent on the cooperative conditions, it would be able to act.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: But it does not act.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa dang 'ga' zhig pas kyang rung ba thams cad du byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa dang 'ga' zhig pas kyang rung ba thams cad du byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means that it is possible for it to function in every way, even in dependence on its cooperating conditions or in dependence on some of them.

original: mdor bstan pa'i dag 'di nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i dag 'di nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin pa zhes smos so //
translated: In order to clarify this brief presentation, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is momentary.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i don la ni rim dang cig car de dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i don la ni rim dang cig car de dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the meaning of ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is incompatible with gradual or simultaneous functioning.

original: rim gyis ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni re zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa la rim ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni re zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa la rim ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not gradual, he says, because gradual functioning does not exist for something that is not momentary.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Why is that? He says:

original: gang zhig lhan cig byed pa dag la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa de ni sdod pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig lhan cig byed pa dag la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa de ni sdod pa ste /
translated: That which does not depend on cooperating conditions does not function.

original: dus 'gro ba'i byed pa de mi rigs so //
analyzed: dus 'gro ba'i byed pa de mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable for it to function at another time.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rang yod pa tsam gyis byed pa por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang yod pa tsam gyis byed pa por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is a functioning agent by its mere existence.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa por gyur pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa por gyur pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no functioning entity that is a functioning agent by the nature of another.

original: gzhan gyis 'bras bu byas na gzhan byed pa po nyid du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'bras bu byas na gzhan byed pa po nyid du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If another performs the effect, it is not tenable that another is the agent.

original: des na rang yod pas rang gi ngo bos dngos po byed pa por 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang yod pas rang gi ngo bos dngos po byed pa por 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it exists, it is the agent of the thing by means of its own nature.

original: de'i nyi ma gsum pa 'am skad cig gsum pa la 'bras bu byed nus pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dang po nyid kyi nyi ma 'am skad cig la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i nyi ma gsum pa 'am skad cig gsum pa la 'bras bu byed nus pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dang po nyid kyi nyi ma 'am skad cig la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is able to perform the effect on the third day or the third moment, then it exists on the first day or the first moment.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would perform the effect that is related to it.

original: 'di snyam du skad cig dang po la ni de la byed pa po'i rang bzhin med pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du skad cig dang po la ni de la byed pa po'i rang bzhin med pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that at the first moment it does not have the nature of an agent,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / sngar byed pa po ma yin pa ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa / sngar byed pa po ma yin pa ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Previously it is not an agent, and later it is not either.

original: rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not change its nature.

original: rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not change into another form.

original: des na phyis byed pa po yin na ni de skad cig dang por yang byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na phyis byed pa po yin na ni de skad cig dang por yang byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if it is an agent later, then it is an agent at the first moment.

original: 'di snyam du byed pa po nyid yin yang lhan cig pa la ltos nas rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du byed pa po nyid yin yang lhan cig pa la ltos nas rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that although the agent itself is simultaneous, it produces the effect gradually in dependence on the simultaneous conditions,

original: bshad pa / ltos pa yin na ni yang rig byed sun 'byin pa'i skabs su ji ltar skad cig ma yin pa ltos par mi rigs pa de ltar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad pa / ltos pa yin na ni yang rig byed sun 'byin pa'i skabs su ji ltar skad cig ma yin pa ltos par mi rigs pa de ltar bshad zin to //
translated: then, as has been explained in the context of refuting the thesis that the effect is similar to the cause, it is not tenable that a momentary entity is dependent.

original: 'di snyam du 'bras bu byed pa nyid kyis cig car byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'bras bu byed pa nyid kyis cig car byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the effect is produced all at once by the agent,

original: bshad pa / cig car byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / cig car byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then it is not produced all at once.

original: de'i zhes @245b bya ba nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni phyis kyang zhes bya ba skad cig dang po'i 'og rol du yang mi byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes @245b bya ba nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni phyis kyang zhes bya ba skad cig dang po'i 'og rol du yang mi byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that the nature of the capacity of that agent to produce the effect would not produce the effect later, that is, after the first moment.

original: dngos po de'i rang bzhin gang gis skad cig dang por 'bras bu byed pa'i rang bzhin de ni skad cig gnyis pa na yang yod pa'i phyir skad cig dang po bzhin du ma tshang ba med par thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po de'i rang bzhin gang gis skad cig dang por 'bras bu byed pa'i rang bzhin de ni skad cig gnyis pa na yang yod pa'i phyir skad cig dang po bzhin du ma tshang ba med par thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the nature of that thing which produces the effect in the first instant exists in the second instant, it would produce all effects in the same way as in the first instant, without anything missing.

original: skad cig gnyis par gang byas pa de byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin ni skad cig dang por yod pa'i phyir skad cig dang por 'bras bu de byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skad cig gnyis par gang byas pa de byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin ni skad cig dang por yod pa'i phyir skad cig dang por 'bras bu de byed par 'gyur la /
translated: Because the nature of the capacity to produce that which is produced in the second instant exists in the first instant, the effect would be produced in the first instant.

original: skad cig dang por byas pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la yang byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig dang por byas pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la yang byed par 'gyur te /
translated: And whatever is produced in the first instant would all be produced in the second instant,

original: de'i rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature exists.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po skad cig gnyis gnas pa yang /üîΩrim dang cig car don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po skad cig gnyis gnas pa yang / rim dang cig car don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in that way, even if a thing endures for two instants,üîΩit is untenable that it produces effects sequentially or all at once.

original: skad cig ma yin pa la ni don byed nus pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa la ni don byed nus pa med do //
translated: And if it is momentary, it cannot produce effects.

original: des na gang gi phyir thams cad las nus pa ldog pa de'i phyir 'di'i skad cig ma yin pa'i don de ni yod pa'i rang bzhin las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir thams cad las nus pa ldog pa de'i phyir 'di'i skad cig ma yin pa'i don de ni yod pa'i rang bzhin las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for anything to be a potency, the meaning of ‚Äúmomentariness‚Äù is beyond the nature of existence.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes mjug sdud pa ste des na med pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes mjug sdud pa ste des na med pa yin no //
translated: The conclusion is that since the characteristic does not exist, it is nonexistent.

original: de nyid bsdu pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bsdu pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to summarize that, it is said:

original: don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po de kho na rnam par dpyod pa 'am /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po de kho na rnam par dpyod pa 'am /
translated: That which is able to perform a function is a thing.

original: 'gro ba 'dir don dam pa ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dir don dam pa ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin no //
translated: In this world, it exists in the unfabricated nature of ultimate reality.

original: shin tu skur pa lhur len pas kyang don dam par don byed par nus pa la bsnyon pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang rnam par bzhag nas dngos po yod par brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: shin tu skur pa lhur len pas kyang don dam par don byed par nus pa la bsnyon pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang rnam par bzhag nas dngos po yod par brjod par bya'i /
translated: Even those who are very intent on denigrating everything must deny that which is able to perform a function ultimately and also must deny that which is able to perform a function conventionally.

original: don dam par don byed nus pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par don byed nus pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should say that things exist, but not that they ultimately are able to perform a function.

original: gang gi phyir don byed par nus pa yod pa yin pa des na skad cig ma ma yin pa ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don byed par nus pa yod pa yin pa des na skad cig ma ma yin pa ni med pa yin te /
translated: Since that which is able to perform a function exists, that which is not momentary is nonexistent.

original: rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to be both gradual and instantaneous.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rim dang cig car med pa nyid gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rim dang cig car med pa nyid gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the absence of gradual and instantaneous activity is shown to be a valid refutation.

original: 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid ni gzhi 'ding bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid ni gzhi 'ding bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The absence of a cause for cessation is the basis for the refutation.

original: yang na phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i byas pa mi rtag par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i byas pa mi rtag par grub pa yin te /
translated: Or, whatever is the nature of the aggregates, elements, and media, that is established as impermanent because of being produced.

original: des na 'di yang nges pa med pa yin te zhes gang brjod pa'i skyon de med do //
analyzed: des na 'di yang nges pa med pa yin te zhes gang brjod pa'i skyon de med do //
translated: Therefore, this is not the fault that was mentioned, namely, that there is no certainty.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba las tha dad pa'i dngos po srid pa gang yin pa'i yul de la ni kho bo cag gis khyab pa bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba las tha dad pa'i dngos po srid pa gang yin pa'i yul de la ni kho bo cag gis khyab pa bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not teach a universal that applies to the domain of the possible, which is different from the perception of form, etc.

original: gang dag la khyab pa @246a * //
analyzed: gang dag la khyab pa @246a * //
translated: Those who teach a universal

original: bstan par bya ba de dag ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu dag la nges pa med pa de tsam dang rjes su 'brel par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba de dag ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu dag la nges pa med pa de tsam dang rjes su 'brel par mthong ba yin no //
translated: Because those things to be destroyed are by nature perishable, one sees that they are related to just that much, i.e., the absence of a cause for their destruction.

original: des na rnam pa 'dis ni 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid ni rgyu nges pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'dis ni 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid ni rgyu nges pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, by this method, the absence of a cause for destruction is taught as a characteristic of the absence of a cause for their existence.

original: de ltar bstan pas kyang rgyu dang ldan pa thams cad 'jig par grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas kyang rgyu dang ldan pa thams cad 'jig par grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And by this teaching, it is established that everything that has a cause is perishable.

original: rim dang cig car 'gal ba'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rim dang cig car 'gal ba'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not by the power of the contradiction of sequential and simultaneous occurrence.

original: yang ji ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag par sgrub ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag par sgrub ce na /
translated: How is impermanence established as the characteristic of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases?

original: bshad pa / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi ngo bo ma yin pa la ni tshad ma med pas ma grub pa'i phyir te ma nges pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba sgrub pa rjes su 'gro ba ston pa gang yin pa de miüîΩ'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi ngo bo ma yin pa la ni tshad ma med pas ma grub pa'i phyir te ma nges pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba sgrub pa rjes su 'gro ba ston pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is uncertain, it is untenable to demonstrate the pervasion of the proof that is the forward pervasion.

original: tshad ma nges pa'i dngos po la byas pa'am yod pa bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pas rjes su 'gro ba bstan par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma nges pa'i dngos po la byas pa'am yod pa bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pas rjes su 'gro ba bstan par nus pa yin te /
translated: It is possible to demonstrate the pervasion of the proof that is the forward pervasion in relation to a thing that is ascertained by valid cognition, or that exists, by the probandum impermanence.

original: de'i phyir tshad mas mthong ba'i phyung po lnga po nyid la gtan tshigs bsgrub byas rjes su 'gro bar bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad mas mthong ba'i phyung po lnga po nyid la gtan tshigs bsgrub byas rjes su 'gro bar bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the pervasion of the proof should be demonstrated in relation to the five aggregates that are seen by valid cognition.

original: ma mthong ba'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig brtags pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir de la khyab pa bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig brtags pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir de la khyab pa bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Whatever aspect is not seen and is imagined is not of that aspect, so the pervasion cannot be demonstrated in relation to it.

original: 'di snyam du gal te byas pa 'am yod pa de tsam 'ga' zhig gzung na ni de'i tshe grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te byas pa 'am yod pa de tsam 'ga' zhig gzung na ni de'i tshe grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf we apprehend that mere action or existence, then at that time we would contradict our tenets,‚Äù

original: bshad pa / kho bo cag gis byas pa ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / kho bo cag gis byas pa ni de nyid yin te /
translated: we respond: That is precisely what we do.

original: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /üîΩji skad du chos mngon pa las 'dus byas te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa / ji skad du chos mngon pa las 'dus byas te /
translated: That is why it is said:üîΩIn the Abhidharma, after asking, ‚ÄúWhat is a conditioned phenomenon?‚Äù

original: byas pa'i chos gang yin zhe na zhes dri ba byas nas phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pas de nyid du lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i chos gang yin zhe na zhes dri ba byas nas phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pas de nyid du lan btab pa yin no //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe five aggregates.‚Äù Thus, that is the answer.

original: phung po lnga po de la dbang po lnga ni'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de la dbang po lnga ni'o //
translated: Among those five aggregates, the five faculties are the five faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: 'pho ba'i rang bzhin de gang dag la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i rang bzhin de gang dag la yod pa'o //
translated: They are the nature of movement.

original: yang ji ltar na lkog tu gyur pa'i dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'pho ba can yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na lkog tu gyur pa'i dbang po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'pho ba can yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is the nature of the faculties that are hidden the nature of movement?

original: bshad pa / de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de rnam par 'chad pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de rnam par 'chad pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: We respond: The consciousness that is the result of those faculties is interrupted and changes.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ldog pa las dbang po de dag yod pa yin pa de bzhin du de'i 'bras bu rnam par chad pa mthong ba'i phyir rgyu yang rnam par chad par rjes su dpog la /
