analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ldog pa las dbang po de dag yod pa yin pa de bzhin du de'i 'bras bu rnam par chad pa mthong ba'i phyir rgyu yang rnam par chad par rjes su dpog la /
translated: Just as the existence of those sense faculties is inferred from the cessation of the effect, consciousness, in the same way, the cause is inferred to be interrupted because the effect is seen to be interrupted.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba rnam par 'gyur @246b ba mthong ba'i phyir ni de dag kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba rnam par 'gyur @246b ba mthong ba'i phyir ni de dag kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du rjes su dpog go //
translated: And because the manifestation and non-manifestation of change is seen, they are inferred to change in another way.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ldog pa 'am rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med par ni 'bras bu de dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa ni rang bzhin de nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ldog pa 'am rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med par ni 'bras bu de dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa ni rang bzhin de nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that without the cessation of the cause or its change into another form, those effects would not occur.

original: de dag gi sngar gyi gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba med pa rnam par chad pa med pa gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi sngar gyi gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba med pa rnam par chad pa med pa gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de /
translated: If that very nature of those that existed previously, without change and without interruption,

original: de yin na ni rnam par chad pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yin na ni rnam par chad pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that very nature would exist, and it is untenable that it would be interrupted and change.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i don ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas 'bras bu byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i don ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas 'bras bu byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnon-momentary‚Äù is that it does not produce an effect in dependence on the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: bshad pa ni ltos par 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa ni ltos par 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation is that it is contradictory to be dependent.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nyid kyis ni yul rnams kyang mi rtag pa nyid du brtag par nus mod kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nyid kyis ni yul rnams kyang mi rtag pa nyid du brtag par nus mod kyi /
translated: Since the effect, consciousness, is intermittent, it is possible to infer that the objects are impermanent.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid kyis shes par nus so zhes bshad pa ni de bzhin du yul skye ba dang 'gag pa so sor rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid kyis shes par nus so zhes bshad pa ni de bzhin du yul skye ba dang 'gag pa so sor rig pa nyid do //
translated: However, it is said that they can be known by direct perception, and in the same way, the arising and cessation of objects can be individually known.

original: re zhig skye ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnams kyi so sor rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig skye ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnams kyi so sor rig pa nyid do //
translated: Arising is individually known by those who have the characteristic of apprehension.

original: de bzhin du ba ltar rung ba rnams kyi 'gag pa yang des dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa las so sor rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba ltar rung ba rnams kyi 'gag pa yang des dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa las so sor rig pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, cessation is individually known by those who are suitable for it, from the apprehension of a place devoid of it, and so on.

original: gzugs kyi phung po bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of form has been explained.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis so sor rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis so sor rig pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, pleasure and pain are known by each one through the direct perception of self-awareness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa yang so sor rig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa yang so sor rig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, their arising and cessation are also known by each one.

original: 'dis ni tshor ba'i phung po bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshor ba'i phung po bshad do //
translated: By this, the aggregate of feeling is explained.

original: mtshan ma ste don rnams kyi phan tshun dben pa nye bar rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ste don rnams kyi phan tshun dben pa nye bar rtogs pa ste /
translated: The sign is the apprehension of the mutual isolation of objects.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang so sor rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang so sor rig pa yin no //
translated: That which has the nature of apprehension is also known by each one.

original: 'dis ni 'du shes kyi phung po bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du shes kyi phung po bshad do //
translated: By this, the aggregate of perception is explained.

original: gang gi phyir 'du shes ni don rnams kyi rigs gcig pa dang rigs tha dad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan ma rgyu mtshan du gyur pa thun mong gi rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du shes ni don rnams kyi rigs gcig pa dang rigs tha dad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan ma rgyu mtshan du gyur pa thun mong gi rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Because perception is the sign that establishes the sameness and difference of types of objects, it distinguishes the common nature of the causes.

original: de ltar gyur pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de yang mngon sum gyis grub pas de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de yang mngon sum gyis grub pas de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa yang grub pa yin no //
translated: That which has become such a nature of apprehension is also established by direct perception, so its arising and cessation are also established.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúattachment, etc.‚Äù is stated in order to indicate the aggregate of karmic formations.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la zhen pa'i ni 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la zhen pa'i ni 'dod chags yin no //
translated: Attachment is the adherence to the things that are the basis of affliction.

original: de yang skye ba dang 'gag ba so sor rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang skye ba dang 'gag ba so sor rig pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the recognition of origination and cessation.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to hatred, etc.

original: yul nye bar dmigs pa ni 'dzin bsten par shes ba'o //
analyzed: yul nye bar dmigs pa ni 'dzin bsten par shes ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of an object is the recognition of the object‚Äôs presence.

original: de yang skye ba dang 'gag pa so sor @247a * //üîΩrig pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang skye ba dang 'gag pa so sor @247a * // rig pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the recognition of origination and cessation.

original: 'dir yang yul tsam 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang yul tsam 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: Here, the mere apprehension of an object is consciousness.

original: rigs gcig pa dang rigs tha dad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan ma'i rang bzhin rnam par dbye bar nus pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni 'du shes yin zhing /
analyzed: rigs gcig pa dang rigs tha dad pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan ma'i rang bzhin rnam par dbye bar nus pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni 'du shes yin zhing /
translated: The essence of conceptualization is the ability to distinguish the essential characteristics of things that are established as being of the same type or of different types.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin mngon par zhen pa ni 'dod chags yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin mngon par zhen pa ni 'dod chags yin te /
translated: Attachment is the adherence to the essence of conceptualization.

original: phung po gsum po de dag gi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: phung po gsum po de dag gi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'di nyid yin no //
translated: These are the divisions of the three aggregates.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù means ‚Äúcoming into existence.‚Äù

original: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCessation‚Äù means ‚Äúperishing.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are impermanent.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phung po lnga po de dag ni rang gi rgyu'i rang bzhin de lta bu'i ngo bor 'jig pa skyed par nus pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phung po lnga po de dag ni rang gi rgyu'i rang bzhin de lta bu'i ngo bor 'jig pa skyed par nus pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: The five aggregates, which have such a nature, are established as having the nature of destruction, because their causes are capable of producing them in such a way.

original: rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: They are understood to be that way.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed pa de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i ngag skyes pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bdag nyid dang 'dra bar 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bor rtogs par byed pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed pa de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i ngag skyes pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bdag nyid dang 'dra bar 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bor rtogs par byed pa
translated: Because they are understood to have such a nature, which is the nature of their causes, therefore, those things that arise in such a way are understood to have a nature of destruction, just like themselves.

original: yin no // de bshad pa ni rang gi ngon de la sbyor bar byed pa yin te 'brel par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // de bshad pa ni rang gi ngon de la sbyor bar byed pa yin te 'brel par byed pa yin no //
translated: They are explained to be connected with that nature, that is, they are related to that nature.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gzugs la sogs pa thams cad 'jig pa'i ngo bor mthong bas gzugs la sogs pa skyed par nus pa'i rang bzhin thams cad 'jig pa'i rang bzhin skyed par nus par rjes su dpog pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa thams cad 'jig pa'i ngo bor mthong bas gzugs la sogs pa skyed par nus pa'i rang bzhin thams cad 'jig pa'i rang bzhin skyed par nus par rjes su dpog pa yin te /
translated: Since all forms and so on are seen to be of the nature of destruction, one can infer that the nature of destruction is able to generate the nature of all things that are able to generate forms and so on.

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyu la nges pa med par thams cad las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rgyu la nges pa med par thams cad las skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the nature of destruction of forms and so on is not ascertained as the cause of forms and so on, but it arises from everything.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa'i ngo bor 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa'i ngo bor 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
translated: Therefore it is established that all produced forms and so on are of the nature of impermanence. Thus the pervasion is established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don gyi rnam pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu thams cad la nges pa med pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin rgyu med pa nyid ni khyab pa sgrub par byed pa gnod pa'i tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don gyi rnam pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu thams cad la nges pa med pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin rgyu med pa nyid ni khyab pa sgrub par byed pa gnod pa'i tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the proof of the pervasion that the nature of destruction, which is not ascertained as the cause of all things that are able to generate the aspect of an object, is causeless is undermined by valid knowledge.

original: phung po rnams mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa 'dis ni khams dang skyed mched dag ni khams dang skye mched de dag kyang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa 'dis ni khams dang skyed mched dag ni khams dang skye mched de dag kyang bshad pa yin no //
translated: The aggregates are established as impermanent. The elements and sense bases are also explained as being the elements and sense bases.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni skye mched dang khams lnga yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni skye mched dang khams lnga yin no //
translated: Thus, the five faculties such as the eye are the five sense bases and the five elements.

original: de bzhin du yul yang skye mched lnga dang khams lnga yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yang skye mched lnga dang khams lnga yin no //
translated: Similarly, the objects are the five sense bases and the five elements.

original: yul nye bar dmigs pa ni yid kyi @247b skye mched yin la /
analyzed: yul nye bar dmigs pa ni yid kyi @247b skye mched yin la /
translated: The apprehension of the object is the sense base of the mental faculty.

original: phung po gsum po ni chos kyi khams dang skye mched yin no //
analyzed: phung po gsum po ni chos kyi khams dang skye mched yin no //
translated: The three aggregates are the element and sense base of mental objects.

original: yid kyi skye mched nyid kyang sems kyi khams bdun yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched nyid kyang sems kyi khams bdun yin te /
translated: The sense base of the mental faculty is also the seven elements of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar dang / rten tha dad pas tha dad pa'i sems kyi khams drug po de dag nyid gang dang gang 'das ma thag pa phyi ma skyed par byed pa de nyid ni yid ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar dang / rten tha dad pas tha dad pa'i sems kyi khams drug po de dag nyid gang dang gang 'das ma thag pa phyi ma skyed par byed pa de nyid ni yid ces brjod pa'o //
translated: The six elements of consciousness are different because of their different supports. Those very six elements of consciousness that have just ceased generate the subsequent ones. That very one is called the mental faculty.

original: de'i phyir phung po lnga dang skye ma ched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad kyi byas pa 'am yod pa ni mi rtag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lnga dang skye ma ched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad kyi byas pa 'am yod pa ni mi rtag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five aggregates, twelve sense bases, and eighteen elements that are produced or exist are taught to be impermanent.

original: gal te chos kyi ming can gyi khams dang skye mched nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag ni rtag tu yod pa dang ma byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi ming can gyi khams dang skye mched nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag ni rtag tu yod pa dang ma byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt the space element and the cessation that is a separation and the cessation not due to analysis, which are called phenomena, always existent and unproduced?

original: des na skye mched dang khams kyang mi rtag par grub po zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na skye mched dang khams kyang mi rtag par grub po zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: So how can it be said that the sense bases and elements are established as impermanent?

original: chos kyi zhes smos te /
analyzed: chos kyi zhes smos te /
translated: The term phenomena is stated.

original: chos kyi skye mched dang khams de dag kyang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed de phung po gsum po de nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched dang khams de dag kyang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed de phung po gsum po de nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those phenomena sense bases and elements are the three aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir khams dang skye mched dag kyang mi rtag par 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir khams dang skye mched dag kyang mi rtag par 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since that is the case, there is no contradiction in stating that the elements and sense bases are impermanent.

original: 'di ltar phung po gsum po de dag ni mi rtag pa sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po gsum po de dag ni mi rtag pa sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Thus, these three aggregates are established as impermanent.

original: de las tha dad pa nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mdo sde pas bkag pa dang khas ma blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mdo sde pas bkag pa dang khas ma blangs pa yin no //
translated: The Sautrantikas refute and do not accept a fourth aggregate, space, etc.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi byas pa mi rtag pas khyab pa bsgrubs pa 'dis ni yod pa 'ang me rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi byas pa mi rtag pas khyab pa bsgrubs pa 'dis ni yod pa 'ang me rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This proof that the aggregates, elements, and media are impermanent because they are produced proves that whatever exists is impermanent because it is produced.

original: 'di ltar phung po dang / khams dang skye mched nyid rgyus yod pa byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po dang / khams dang skye mched nyid rgyus yod pa byas pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the aggregates, elements, and media are produced because they exist.

original: de yang rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: And they are produced because they have causes.

original: rgyu rnams la yang 'jig pa nges pa med par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jig pa nyid kyis khyab po //
analyzed: rgyu rnams la yang 'jig pa nges pa med par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jig pa nyid kyis khyab po //
translated: And they are impermanent because their destruction is not certain, since it is established that causes have destruction.

original: gal te dbang po rnams rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis yin zhing /
translated: If the elements are inferred from the senses,

original: de las gzhan rnams ni mngon sum gyis grub pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa yin na /
analyzed: de las gzhan rnams ni mngon sum gyis grub pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa yin na /
translated: The rest are established by direct perception. Thus, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are established as impermanent.

original: 'o na dngos po 'jig pa ltos pa med pa la nus pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'o na dngos po 'jig pa ltos pa med pa la nus pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: But the destruction of things does not occur without a cause.

original: gal te dngos po rnams 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa las 'jig pa nyid du grub pa de lta na ni ltos ba med ba nus par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams 'jig pa la ltos pa med pa las 'jig pa nyid du grub pa de lta na ni ltos ba med ba nus par 'gyur na /
translated: If the destruction of things were established as destruction without a cause, then that which is without a cause would be able to exist.

original: de lta ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i nyid ston par byed pa ni phung po la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i nyid ston par byed pa ni phung po la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúThe aggregates, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pas @248a * //
analyzed: sogs pas @248a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: ni khams dang skye mched gzung ngo //
analyzed: ni khams dang skye mched gzung ngo //
translated: refers to the elements and sense bases.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan kho nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams ni 'bras bu rnam par 'chad pa dang 'gyur ba mthong ba las mi rtag pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan kho nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams ni 'bras bu rnam par 'chad pa dang 'gyur ba mthong ba las mi rtag pa yin zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúBy another reason‚Äù means that the faculties are impermanent because their effects are seen to be interrupted and to change.

original: gzhan rnams ni nyams su myong ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni nyams su myong ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The rest are established as impermanent by experience itself.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To refute that, he says,

original: nyams su myong ba dang 'bras bu mthong ba las ni 'ga' zhig mi rtag par grub kyang rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba de dang 'dra ba gzugs la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i byas pa'am yod pa dag mi rtag pa nyid des khyab pa ni ltos
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'bras bu mthong ba las ni 'ga' zhig mi rtag par grub kyang rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba de dang 'dra ba gzugs la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i byas pa'am yod pa dag mi rtag pa nyid des khyab pa ni ltos
translated: Some may establish impermanence through experience and seeing the result, but they do not see that which is similar to that called the aspect, such as form and so on, and they do not see that that which is produced or exists is pervaded by impermanence.üîΩ

original: pa med pa las yin no //
analyzed: pa med pa las yin no //
translated: But from the experience and seeing of the result, one sees that although some things are established as impermanent, the impermanence that pervades the produced or existent things such as form that are not seen in that aspect or that are similar to it is not due to the absence of a cause.

original: gal te rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du gyur na ci'i phyir khyab pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du gyur na ci'i phyir khyab pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it had a cause, how could it be nonpervasive?

original: 'jig pa la rgyu yod pa nyid yin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'jig pa la rgyu yod pa nyid yin na zhes smos so //
translated: If destruction had a cause,

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba dag gi 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa skyed pa'i rgyu la rag las pa ma yin par 'gyur ba des na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba dag gi 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa skyed pa'i rgyu la rag las pa ma yin par 'gyur ba des na /
translated: if the destruction of things such as form that are seen had a cause, then at that time the nature of destruction would not depend on the cause that produces things such as form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang dag la 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba de dag nyid 'jig par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag la 'jig pa'i rgyu'i gags yod pa dang ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir nye ba med pa na mi 'jig par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ma khyab par yang
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang dag la 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba de dag nyid 'jig par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag la 'jig pa'i rgyu'i gags yod pa dang ma tshang ba srid pa'i phyir nye ba med pa na mi 'jig par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ma khyab par yang
translated: But those things such as form that are near the cause of destruction are destroyed, while those that are not near the cause of destruction are not destroyed because it is possible that the cause of destruction is obstructed or incomplete.üîΩTherefore, the reason is not included in the predicate.

original: 'gyur ro // des na gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po 'jig pa skyed par byed pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // des na gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po 'jig pa skyed par byed pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the destruction of things does not depend on a cause other than the one that produces them,

original: skyed par byed pa tsam la rag las pa ni 'di'i ltos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa tsam la rag las pa ni 'di'i ltos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: it is said that they are independent in that they depend merely on the cause that produces them.üîΩThis argument refutes the idea that there is a certain substance called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù that has the nature of destruction and that it comes into existence at a certain time.

original: rgyu med pa nyid 'dis ni 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rang bzhin rdzas 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba dus 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba na rdzas dang dus kyi khyad par can gyi dngos po deüîΩmed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid 'dis ni 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rang bzhin rdzas 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba dus 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba na rdzas dang dus kyi khyad par can gyi dngos po deüîΩmed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: It proves that the nature of things that have the attributes of substance and time is to be nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir 'gal zhe na ltos pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gal zhe na ltos pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni zhes smos te /
translated: Why is it contradictory? He says, ‚ÄúWhatever has the nature of being dependent . . .‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúindeed‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir res 'ga' 'gyur ba'i 'jig pa ni dus de la ltos pa dang 'ga' zhig la 'gyur ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du rdzas de'i rgyu la so sor nges pa de la ltos par 'gyur ba de'i phyir res 'ga' 'am 'ga' zhig laüîΩ'gyur na ni ltos pa dang bcas pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir res 'ga' 'gyur ba'i 'jig pa ni dus de la ltos pa dang 'ga' zhig la 'gyur ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du rdzas de'i rgyu la so sor nges pa de la ltos par 'gyur ba de'i phyir res 'ga' 'am 'ga' zhig la 'gyur na ni ltos pa dang bcas pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Because sometimes destruction occurs in dependence on that time, and sometimes it occurs in dependence on the cause of that substance, like something that is impeded, it is determined individually. Therefore, if it occurs sometimes or somewhere, it is pervaded by being dependent.

original: ltos pa med pa nyid ni de dang 'gal ba yin pa de'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid ni de dang 'gal ba yin pa de'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: And being without dependence is contradictory with that. Therefore it is contradictory with the pervasion.

original: 'ga' zhig la 'gyur ba 'gal bas ni thams cad 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la 'gyur ba 'gal bas ni thams cad 'jig pa yin la /
translated: Since it is contradictory for it to occur somewhere, everything would be destroyed.

original: @248b res 'ga' 'gyur ba 'gal bas ni skyes pa nyid na 'jig pa skad cig ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @248b res 'ga' 'gyur ba 'gal bas ni skyes pa nyid na 'jig pa skad cig ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is contradictory for it to occur sometimes, it is explained that what is produced is momentary and is destroyed.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la 'jig pa nyid rang gi ngo bo ste 'jig pa de ni de dang der bshad zin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la 'jig pa nyid rang gi ngo bo ste 'jig pa de ni de dang der bshad zin la /
translated: But if you say that destruction is an intrinsic reality, then destruction has already been explained in various places.

original: de yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since it is not dependent on anything else, it would be causeless.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir mi 'gyur te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir mi 'gyur te zhes smos so //
translated: To counter that, it says, ‚ÄúIt would not be so.‚Äù

original: dngos po yod pa'i rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid las de ltar 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid las de ltar 'jig pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du skye'o //
translated: The intrinsic reality of destruction arises from the intrinsic reality of an existent thing, and that is its cause.

original: gal te gang las yod par skye ba de las 'jig pa ji ltar skye 'di ltar 'bras bu'i khyad par ni lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par nyid las yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang las yod par skye ba de las 'jig pa ji ltar skye 'di ltar 'bras bu'i khyad par ni lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par nyid las yin te /
translated: If destruction arises from that from which an existent thing arises, how could it arise? In this way, the difference in an effect arises from the difference in the cooperating causes.

original: dper na bum pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni rdza mkhan las yin la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni rdza mkhan las yin la /
translated: For example, the difference in the shape of a pot arises from the potter, but its intrinsic reality arises from clay.

original: 'ji ba las ni de'i ngo bo yin pa bzhin du 'dir yang 'jig pa nyid rgyu gzhan las brtag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'ji ba las ni de'i ngo bo yin pa bzhin du 'dir yang 'jig pa nyid rgyu gzhan las brtag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, here too, destruction should be conceived to arise from another cause.

original: yod pa 'byung ba ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: yod pa 'byung ba ni zhes smos te /
translated: To counter that, it says, ‚ÄúThe arising of an existent thing.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid du grub pa ni de 'dra ba 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du grub pa ni de 'dra ba 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is established as existent would become just that which is destroyed.

original: gang zhig phan tshun 'khrul pa de la ni rgyu tha dad par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig phan tshun 'khrul pa de la ni rgyu tha dad par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: And that which is mutually confused is understood to have a different cause,

original: dper na dbyibs dang sa'i rang bzhin dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbyibs dang sa'i rang bzhin dag bzhin no //
translated: like shape and the nature of earth.

original: 'dir phan tshun 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir phan tshun 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here there is no mutual confusion,

original: gang gi phyir gang cung zad yod pa de dag thams cad ni 'jig pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang cung zad yod pa de dag thams cad ni 'jig pa kho na ste /
translated: because whatever exists, all of that is just destroyed.

original: des na 'dir yod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir yod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, here whatever is the cause of existence is just the cause of engagement.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par las 'ga' zhig tu rgyu'i khyad par rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par las 'ga' zhig tu rgyu'i khyad par rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the difference of a cause is understood in some cases from the difference of an effect,

original: 'bras bu thams cad du khyad par med na ni rgyu yang khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad du khyad par med na ni rgyu yang khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then if there is no difference of effect, the cause also would not be different. This is the meaning.

original: gal te yod pa'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa skye na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa skye na /
translated: If destruction arises from the cause of existence,

original: 'o na ni rgyu med pa can gyi yod pa gang yin pa de mi 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu med pa can gyi yod pa gang yin pa de mi 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: then whatever exists without a cause would not be destroyed.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i don ni gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i don ni gdon mi za bar 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúexistence‚Äù is not necessarily arising from something else.

original: ma skyes pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because that which is not arisen also exists.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / glo bur ba ni rgyu med pa ste de'i phyir yod pa 'di rdzas 'ga' zhig la ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / glo bur ba ni rgyu med pa ste de'i phyir yod pa 'di rdzas 'ga' zhig la ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The adventitious is causeless. Therefore this existence does not cease in any substance.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: If other substances such as a vase and so on have a cause,

original: rgyu med pa ni gzhan de dag dang rigs mi mthun pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni gzhan de dag dang rigs mi mthun pa ma yin nam /
translated: and that which is causeless is not dissimilar to those other things,

original: de'i yod pa ni ji lta ba gzhan gyi gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yod pa ni ji lta ba gzhan gyi gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could its existence be different from those?

original: bden te 'on kyang 'ga' zhig la ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang 'ga' zhig la ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: Indeed, that is so. But what is the meaning of ‚Äúit does not cease in any substance‚Äù?

original: rang bzhin 'dir ma gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dir ma gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit does not become something that is not this intrinsic nature‚Äù is that nothing is nonexistent.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid can @249a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid can @249a * //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit has the nature of everything‚Äù is that it is not nonexistent.

original: du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit does not cease‚Äù is that it is not nonexistent.

original: gal te de rang bzhin tha dad par dam bcas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de rang bzhin tha dad par dam bcas pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not asserted that it is different from intrinsic nature,

original: des na thams cad kyi bdag nyid can du ji ltar thal zhe na /
analyzed: des na thams cad kyi bdag nyid can du ji ltar thal zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it follow that it is the nature of everything?

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ma dog gang yin par thal lo zhes ni mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ma dog gang yin par thal lo zhes ni mi brjod kyi /
translated: We do not say that it follows that it is the form of a pot, etc., or that it is not.

original: 'on kyang khyad par can gyi 'bras bu byed nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par can gyi 'bras bu byed nus pa ste /
translated: However, it is the special effect that is able to perform a function.

original: dper na me dro ba byed nus pa de bzhin du bdag nyid gzhan du gnas pa 'di yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na me dro ba byed nus pa de bzhin du bdag nyid gzhan du gnas pa 'di yang 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as fire is able to perform the function of heat, so too this self that exists in another nature would be.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas yongs su gcad par bya ba de bzhin du de yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas yongs su gcad par bya ba de bzhin du de yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as form, etc., is that which is to be discerned by the eye consciousness, etc., so too that would be.

original: gang la rgyu'i khyad par yod pa de ni nus pa nges par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gang la rgyu'i khyad par yod pa de ni nus pa nges par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If something has a special cause, then its ability is determined.

original: rgyu med pa la ni nges par byed pa med pas mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa la ni nges par byed pa med pas mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it has no cause, then since there is no determiner, it would not be excluded.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba can gyi nus pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba can gyi nus pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that all abilities that are mutually exclusive would exist in it,

original: nus pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would possess all abilities.

original: shes pa thams cad kyis bcad par thal ba ni thams cad kyis thams cad kyi tshe /üîΩthams cad du mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyis bcad par thal ba ni thams cad kyis thams cad kyi tshe / thams cad du mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: It follows that all consciousnesses would perceive all objects,

original: 'bras bu rnams la yang sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams la yang sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and all effects would be connected to all actions.

original: don 'di ni /üîΩde dang de min rang bzhin can //
analyzed: don 'di ni / de dang de min rang bzhin can //
translated: This point has already been examined in the line:

original: zhes bya ba der nges par brtags zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der nges par brtags zin to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would have a nature of both that and not that.‚Äù

original: yul 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba dus la lar ro //
analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba dus la lar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAt some time‚Äù means at some point.üîΩ‚ÄúThis very thing‚Äù is stated in the line ‚ÄúAny thing.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid smras pa ni dngos po gang 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid smras pa ni dngos po gang 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAny thing‚Äù is a verbal form.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la nye bar brten pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la nye bar brten pa ste /
translated: It is based on some place, time, and nature.üîΩIt is either discarded or not discarded.

original: gnas pa 'am ma yin pa yongs su 'dor bar byed pa de'i 'ga' zhig po de 'dor ba 'am brten pa'i dngos po de nyid ni gang la zhes bya ba yul dang dus dang rang bzhin la cung zad 'brel pa'i rgyu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa 'am ma yin pa yongs su 'dor bar byed pa de'i 'ga' zhig po de 'dor ba 'am brten pa'i dngos po de nyid ni gang la zhes bya ba yul dang dus dang rang bzhin la cung zad 'brel pa'i rgyu yod pa yin te /
translated: That which is discarded or not discarded is that very thing that is based on some place, time, and nature.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i yul dang dus dang de dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin la ni rten la /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i yul dang dus dang de dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin la ni rten la /
translated: The object, time, and nature that possess a cause are the basis.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dngos pos spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dngos pos spong ba yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the negation by the thing itself.

original: yang na rgyur gyur pa'i yul dang dus la ni rang bzhin 'brel par sbyar la /
analyzed: yang na rgyur gyur pa'i yul dang dus la ni rang bzhin 'brel par sbyar la /
translated: Or, the object and time that are the cause are connected with the nature.

original: rang bzhin la skyed par byed pa'i rgyu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin la skyed par byed pa'i rgyu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The cause that generates the nature should be connected.

original: gal te 'di 'dra ba'i yod pa 'di yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dang 'brel pa dang bral pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'dra ba'i yod pa 'di yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dang 'brel pa dang bral pa yin na ni /
translated: If this kind of existence is connected with object, time, and nature,

original: rang bzhin la sogs pa nges pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pa nges pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then nature and so on would not possess ascertainment.

original: gang zhig thams cad du thams cad kyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i nges pa yang khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad du thams cad kyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i nges pa yang khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: And ascertainment that does not occur in all cases in every way must be accepted.

original: de'i phyir glo bur ba ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir glo bur ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore adventitiousness does not exist.

original: gal te yod pa glo bur ba med na @249b 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po rgyu med par ji ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa glo bur ba med na @249b 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po rgyu med par ji ltar bshad ce na /
translated: If existence is not adventitious, how can it be said that the thing called destruction is causeless?

original: skyes pa grub pa 'jig pa de'i ngo bor gyur pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las gzhan la me ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa grub pa 'jig pa de'i ngo bor gyur pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las gzhan la me ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause that generates the established entity that is the nature of disintegration does not depend on anything else.

original: don 'di min te /
analyzed: don 'di min te /
translated: This is not the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa las gzhan la mi ltos pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la nges pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa las gzhan la mi ltos pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la nges pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not depend on anything other than the cause of generation, and because it is not ascertained in form and so on,

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ltos pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ltos pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: the nature of disintegration is independent.

original: rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is causeless.

original: gal te 'jig pa las 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po gzhan ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa las 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po gzhan ma yin nam /
translated: If disintegration is not different from the entity that possesses disintegration,

original: des na yod pa'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa skyes par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na yod pa'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa skyes par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could disintegration arise from the cause of existence?

original: gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù

original: 'jig ba ni yod pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin te dngos po las gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig ba ni yod pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin te dngos po las gzhan 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: disintegration arises from the cause of existence, but it is not something other than an entity.

original: gal te gzhan yin na ni yod pa'i rgyu las skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan yin na ni yod pa'i rgyu las skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different, it would not arise from the cause of existence.

original: 'jig pa'i sgras ni ldog pa'i chos kyi dngos po nyid brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sgras ni ldog pa'i chos kyi dngos po nyid brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù expresses the reality of the dharma that is ceasing.

original: de nyid skad cig mar gnas par skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid skad cig mar gnas par skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is because it is produced as enduring for an instant.

original: skad cig mar gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pa'o //
translated: It is that which has the nature of enduring for an instant.

original: dngos po yod pa'i dus gang yin pa 'di nyid skad cig ma gcig yin pa'i phyir skad cig mar gnas pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i dus gang yin pa 'di nyid skad cig ma gcig yin pa'i phyir skad cig mar gnas pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Because it is just this instant that is the time when the thing exists, it is called ‚Äúenduring for an instant.‚ÄùüîΩBut after it is produced, it does not endure for an instant. If it did endure, it would never cease.

original: skyes nas ni skad cig kyang mi gnas te gnas na ni nam yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes mang du bshad zin to ;
analyzed: skyes nas ni skad cig kyang mi gnas te gnas na ni nam yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes mang du bshad zin to ;
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: / gal te don gyi bdag nyid ni 'jig par 'jig rten na mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: / gal te don gyi bdag nyid ni 'jig par 'jig rten na mi brjod kyi /
translated: If you say that in the world, the nature of a thing is not called ‚Äúdestruction,‚Äù

original: 'on kyang dngos po med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: but rather ‚Äúnonexistence,‚Äù

original: gzhan pa rnams kyis 'di'i rang bzhin de zhes smos te /
analyzed: gzhan pa rnams kyis 'di'i rang bzhin de zhes smos te /
translated: then others say that its nature is that.

original: 'khor ba ji srid par ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhan pa ni snang bzhin ba de'i chos thams cad khong du chud par mi nus so ;
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhan pa ni snang bzhin ba de'i chos thams cad khong du chud par mi nus so ;
translated: As long as there is cyclic existence, the weak-minded who are connected with ignorance are not able to comprehend all phenomena as they appear.

original: / de la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni yod pa'i dus las phyis nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / de la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni yod pa'i dus las phyis nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The phenomenon called ‚Äúnon-abiding‚Äù is ascertained after the time of existence.

original: yod pa'i dus nyid du mthong ba yin yang sngar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i dus nyid du mthong ba yin yang sngar ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is seen at the time of existence, it is not seen before.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba yin yang /üîΩmthong ba'i dus su rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba yin yang / mthong ba'i dus su rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the nature of that is seen,

original: ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i zhan pa rnams la mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i zhan pa rnams la mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not posited at the time of seeing because the weak-minded who possess ignorance do not have clear seeing.

original: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin ni ldog pa'i dus su nges pa des na phyis zhes bya ba dus gang dang de'i rang bzhin nges pa'i dus su de'i khyad par can nyid du de'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin ni ldog pa'i dus su nges pa des na phyis zhes bya ba dus gang dang de'i rang bzhin nges pa'i dus su de'i khyad par can nyid du de'i dbang gis te /
translated: Since its nature is ascertained at the time of cessation, later‚Äîat whatever time‚Äîits nature is ascertained, at that time it is qualified by that.

original: nges pa de'i dbang gis dngos po de mi gnas pa'i ngang can 'jig par rnam par 'jog gi /
analyzed: nges pa de'i dbang gis dngos po de mi gnas pa'i ngang can 'jig par rnam par 'jog gi /
translated: By virtue of that ascertainment, that thing is posited as disintegrating, as having a nature that does not endure.

original: @250a * // 'jig pa ldog pa'i gnas skabs nyid yin par ni 'jig rten pas kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @250a * // 'jig pa ldog pa'i gnas skabs nyid yin par ni 'jig rten pas kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: But worldly people do not understand that the state of cessation of disintegration is itself disintegration.

original: de lta ma yin na ni bum pa zhig go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni bum pa zhig go //
translated: If that were not so, then the statement ‚ÄúThe pot has disintegrated‚Äù

original: bum pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: bum pa'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: would not be related to the statement ‚ÄúThe disintegration of the pot.‚Äù

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa dag ni 'brel pa 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa dag ni 'brel pa 'ga' yang med la /
translated: Things and nonthings, which are mutually exclusive, are not related in any way.

original: 'brel pa'i tha snyad kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i tha snyad kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: But the convention of relation does exist.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog pa'i chos de nyid ldog par nges pa'i dus kyi khyad par can gyi 'jig par tha snyad byed pa pos rtogs mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog pa'i chos de nyid ldog par nges pa'i dus kyi khyad par can gyi 'jig par tha snyad byed pa pos rtogs mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although the speaker understands that the cessation of the nature of a thing is disintegration, which is qualified by a specific time of cessation,

original: 'on kyang yod pa dang med pa 'ga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa dang med pa 'ga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not the case that the hearer understands it in the same way.

original: yod pa'i gnas skabs dang 'gal ba med pa'i gnas skabs ni kho bos 'jig par rtogs so zhes rlom pa 'ba' //üîΩnu pa med pa bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: yod pa'i gnas skabs dang 'gal ba med pa'i gnas skabs ni kho bos 'jig par rtogs so zhes rlom pa 'ba' // nu pa med pa bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
translated: We maintain that the state of non-existence is the destruction of the thing that existed previously.

original: dngos po grub na ni zhe can bzhin du ma nges pa phyis nges par 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po grub na ni zhe can bzhin du ma nges pa phyis nges par 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig yod dam zhe na /
translated: If an entity is established, then, like poison, it is certain to exist later, even if it is not certain at first.

original: yod do zhes bshad pa ni mi shes pa rnam par 'gyur ba mthong nas zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: yod do zhes bshad pa ni mi shes pa rnam par 'gyur ba mthong nas zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: The statement ‚Äúit exists‚Äù is made when one sees that ignorance is reversible.

original: / ji ltar dug mi shes pa mthon yang 'chi ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid ni 'di tshe nges pa mi nus te rnam par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs su nge par byed do //
analyzed: / ji ltar dug mi shes pa mthon yang 'chi ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid ni 'di tshe nges pa mi nus te rnam par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs su nge par byed do //
translated: The potency to kill is not certain in the case of poison that is not recognized, but it is ascertained when one sees the change in the state of the poison.

original: de mthong ba'i dus su mi nges pa'i chos ni srid do zhes bya ba'i cha de tsam gyis dpe yin gyi /
analyzed: de mthong ba'i dus su mi nges pa'i chos ni srid do zhes bya ba'i cha de tsam gyis dpe yin gyi /
translated: The aspect of the example is just that much: the property of uncertainty when one sees it.

original: dug gis 'chi ba'i nu pa dus phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dug gis 'chi ba'i nu pa dus phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the potency to kill by poison is established to occur later.

original: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i nus pa ni 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i nus pa ni 'bras bu byed pa'i nus pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus the potency of death is the potency to produce an effect.

original: nus pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
translated: And potency is to be understood by positive and negative concomitance.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa khong du chud pa yang rang bzhin gyi yul can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa khong du chud pa yang rang bzhin gyi yul can yin no //
translated: And positive and negative concomitance with regard to things is the domain of intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir nus pa ni rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa ni rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, potency is indeed intrinsic nature.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig la ltos nas nus pa tha dad par tha snyad du byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig la ltos nas nus pa tha dad par tha snyad du byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But it is only conventionally that potency is said to be different, in dependence on something else.

original: nus pa dang nus pa dang ldan pa dag ni 'gal ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: nus pa dang nus pa dang ldan pa dag ni 'gal ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not the slightest contradiction between potency and that which possesses potency.

original: des na phyi ma gnas skabs kyi khyad par can ni dngos po'i nus pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi ma gnas skabs kyi khyad par can ni dngos po'i nus pa rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference in the later state is not posited as the potency of a thing.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir bum pa'i 'jig pa bum pa'i zhig pa zhes dngos po la ldog pa'i chos can gyi rang bzhin du tha snyad du byed kyang de'i rang bzhin phyis nges pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i gnas skabs dang yod pa'i gnas skabs kyang 'gal ba'i phyir na dus phyis @250b 'byung ba lta bur tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir bum pa'i 'jig pa bum pa'i zhig pa zhes dngos po la ldog pa'i chos can gyi rang bzhin du tha snyad du byed kyang de'i rang bzhin phyis nges pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i gnas skabs dang yod pa'i gnas skabs kyang 'gal ba'i phyir na dus phyis @250b 'byung ba lta bur tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Because the state of nonexistence and the state of existence are mutually exclusive, it is conventionally designated as if it were something that occurs later.

original: 'jig pa ni rang gi ngo bor brjod pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni rang gi ngo bor brjod pa de nyid yin te /
translated: Destruction is just the expression of its own nature.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would be untenable that they are related.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du grub pa yin no //
translated: Things and nonthings are established by worldly convention.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig pa 'di ni skyed par byed pa tsam la rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig pa 'di ni skyed par byed pa tsam la rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore means that because this destruction is the nature that depends on just the producer, therefore

original: yod pa ma gtogs pa yod pa'i rgyu'i khyad par ram /
analyzed: yod pa ma gtogs pa yod pa'i rgyu'i khyad par ram /
translated: apart from existence, there is no difference in the cause of existence.

original: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig la ltos pa med pa yod pa de la khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig la ltos pa med pa yod pa de la khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: and it is the pervader of that which exists without relying on any cause of destruction.

original: gang la gang gi tshe 'jig pa tsam yod pa de la de'i tshe 'jig pa nyid yod pas mtha' dag skad cig tsam gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la gang gi tshe 'jig pa tsam yod pa de la de'i tshe 'jig pa nyid yod pas mtha' dag skad cig tsam gnas pa yin no //
translated: And when there is mere destruction of something, then at that time, there is destruction itself, and so everything endures for just an instant.

original: gang gis skyed par byed pa tsam rag las par rtogs par 'gyur ba yod pa'i rgyu las gzhan la rag las pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las shes she na /
analyzed: gang gis skyed par byed pa tsam rag las par rtogs par 'gyur ba yod pa'i rgyu las gzhan la rag las pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the cause of existence is only that which is the cause of production, and that existence does not rely on anything else?

original: bshad pa / 'jig pa de'i rgyu de'i rgyu de la nus pa med phyir yang /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'jig pa de'i rgyu de'i rgyu de la nus pa med phyir yang /
translated: It is said: Because the cause of destruction has no power with regard to that cause.

original: yang gi sgras ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is not a cause.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
translated: This is the commentary on the verse:

original: yang gi sgras ni dngos po med pa don med pa byed pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na dngos po med pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni dngos po med pa don med pa byed pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na dngos po med pa byed pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that since this mode of existence exists for that which is not a thing, it is that which makes things not be things.

original: der mngon par 'dod pa de'i bya ba bkag pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: der mngon par 'dod pa de'i bya ba bkag pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: It is also because the activity of that which is asserted to be that is refuted.

original: gang zhig dngos po med par byed par 'dod pa de ni byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po med par byed par 'dod pa de ni byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: But if one wishes to make something nonexistent, that is not possible.

original: nus pa med pa bstan pa'i don tu bshad pa /
analyzed: nus pa med pa bstan pa'i don tu bshad pa /
translated: The point of the statement about the absence of power is explained:

original: dngos po grub na ni zhes bya ba skyes na ni rgyu'i dngos pos de byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po grub na ni zhes bya ba skyes na ni rgyu'i dngos pos de byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If an entity is established, that is, if it is produced, the entity is not made by a cause.

original: re zhig tho ba la sogs pa rnams kyis g-yo mo'i gnas skabs skyed pa ni mi 'gog la /
analyzed: re zhig tho ba la sogs pa rnams kyis g-yo mo'i gnas skabs skyed pa ni mi 'gog la /
translated: We do not deny that such things as a hammer produce the state of motion in a pot, etc.

original: ldog pa tsam byed pa yang da lta nyid 'gog par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa tsam byed pa yang da lta nyid 'gog par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: We do deny that they merely cause cessation.

original: lhag par gyur pas byed pa'i rgyus 'jig pa'i rang bzhin byed par 'gyur na bya ba'i rang bzhin de yang gal te dngos po las tha dad par med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: lhag par gyur pas byed pa'i rgyus 'jig pa'i rang bzhin byed par 'gyur na bya ba'i rang bzhin de yang gal te dngos po las tha dad par med pa yin na ni /
translated: If the cause of destruction is something different, then the cause of destruction would make the entity perishable. But if the nature of the entity is not different from the nature of the action,

original: dngos po'i rang gi rgyu nyid las grub zin pa yang des bya bas ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi rgyu nyid las grub zin pa yang des bya bas ma yin no //
translated: then the entity is already established from its own cause, and it is not made by that.

original: gzhan byed na yang de la 'jig pa 'am gzhan yang rung ste cung cad byas pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan byed na yang de la 'jig pa 'am gzhan yang rung ste cung cad byas pa med do //
translated: If it makes something else, then it does not make either the destruction or something else.

original: 'jig pa byas pa'i sngon rol du de'i gnas skabs gang yin pa'i sngar gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa byas pa'i sngon rol du de'i gnas skabs gang yin pa'i sngar gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin te /
translated: Prior to the performance of destruction, it is the prior state of that very thing.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs de la cung zad kyang byas pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs de la cung zad kyang byas pa med do //
translated: Therefore, that state is not produced in the least.

original: gtan tshigs des na dngos po de la 'jig par byed pas gzhan byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na dngos po de la 'jig par byed pas gzhan byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: By that reason, the producer of destruction does not produce another thing.

original: des na 'di don de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang gzhan de dag mi @251a * //
analyzed: des na 'di don de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang gzhan de dag mi @251a * //
translated: Therefore, that which is the nature of that thing and that which does not produce another thing

original: byed pas na cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid ni ltos par bya ba ma yin no //üîΩcung zad mi byed pa yang ltos par bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: byed pas na cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid ni ltos par bya ba ma yin no // cung zad mi byed pa yang ltos par bya ba yin na ni /
translated: does not produce the least thing. That which does not produce the least thing is not dependent.üîΩIf that which does not produce the least thing were dependent,

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de ltar na nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not possible.

original: ji ltar bya ba 'gog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya ba 'gog ce na /
translated: How is activity refuted?

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med par 'gyur ba yin par gzhan dag sems la /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med par 'gyur ba yin par gzhan dag sems la /
translated: It is said: In this way, others think that what is called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is the nonexistence of a thing.

original: kho bo cag gis ni 'jig pa dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni 'jig pa dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: We say that destruction is the very nature of things.

original: des na 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa byed do zhes bya ba thal lo //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa byed do zhes bya ba thal lo //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the cause of destruction causes the nonexistence of things.

original: de la zhes bya ba thal ba der gyur pa na gal te med pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig bya ba yin par gyur na ni de nyid dngos po yin pas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba thal ba der gyur pa na gal te med pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig bya ba yin par gyur na ni de nyid dngos po yin pas so //
translated: If, in that consequence, some entity called ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù were to be the action, then it would be an existent thing.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rjes su byed pa can de ni bya bar brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rjes su byed pa can de ni bya bar brjod la /
translated: Thus, that which is associated with existence and nonexistence is said to be an action.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang ldan pa yang gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang ldan pa yang gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: And that which is associated with existence and nonexistence is the very nature of the negation of another.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma rang bzhin med pa nyid la yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma rang bzhin med pa nyid la yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is not possible for the nature of another to be both existent and nonexistent.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi don kyang dngos po yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi don kyang dngos po yin te /
translated: And an object that is a different nature is an existent thing.

original: de 'dra ba nyid ni don byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid ni don byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a thing is a functioning thing.

original: de yang dngos po yod pa yin pa des na dngos po med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po yod pa yin pa des na dngos po med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: And that is an existent thing, therefore it is not a non-thing.

original: dngos po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa la yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: dngos po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa la yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And the conceptualization of the side of existence has already been explained above.

original: de bas na dngos po med par byed do zhes bya ba ni ldog pa tsam yod pa ma yin pa ni dngos po med pa yin la de yang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byed do zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba'i don dang lhan cig 'brel pa ma yin
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med par byed do zhes bya ba ni ldog pa tsam yod pa ma yin pa ni dngos po med pa yin la de yang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byed do zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba'i don dang lhan cig 'brel pa ma yin
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúmakes a non-thing‚Äù is a mere negation, and a non-thing is a non-existent, and that is not an action, and therefore it is not related to the meaning of the compound ‚Äúmakes.‚Äù

original: pas dgag pa dang lhan cig 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas dgag pa dang lhan cig 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is related to the negation.

original: des na dag gi don ni dngos po mi byed do zhes par thal ba des na bya ba ste byed pa dgag par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dag gi don ni dngos po mi byed do zhes par thal ba des na bya ba ste byed pa dgag par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the compound is ‚Äúdoes not make a thing,‚Äù and that is the consequence. Therefore, the action, i.e., the making, is negated.

original: de lta na yang cung zad mi byed pas 'di ltos par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang cung zad mi byed pas 'di ltos par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But even so, since it does not do anything, it is not to be related to anything.

original: ltos pa med pa da'i phyir 'jig pa de'i rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis te dngos po yod pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa da'i phyir 'jig pa de'i rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis te dngos po yod pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Because of that, the nature of destruction is by its very essence, that is, by the existence of the thing itself.

original: lhag pa'i rgyu'am skyed par byed pa nges pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no//
analyzed: lhag pa'i rgyu'am skyed par byed pa nges pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no//
translated: It does not depend on a special cause or a definite producer.

original: des na dngos po'i rang bzhin las 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos po'i rang bzhin las 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is by the very nature of things that there is change.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod na yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod na yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the nature of a thing exists, then it exists.

original: gang gi tshe 'di las 'gyur ba na rang gi ngo bo ste rgyu la brjod pa de'i tshe ni dngos po'i skyed par byed pa nyid las 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di las 'gyur ba na rang gi ngo bo ste rgyu la brjod pa de'i tshe ni dngos po'i skyed par byed pa nyid las 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: When there is change from this, from its own nature, that is, from its cause, then there is change from the producer of the thing itself,

original: gzhan las ma yin zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du khyad par gyi @251b skyed par byed pa las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan las ma yin zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du khyad par gyi @251b skyed par byed pa las kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not from another, and not from a special producer, like something obstructed. This is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir 'di gang la 'gyur bar grub pa zhes bya ba gang 'ga' zhig la rang gi ngo bos 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di gang la 'gyur bar grub pa zhes bya ba gang 'ga' zhig la rang gi ngo bos 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Because this is established as changing from something, it changes by its own nature from something.

original: rgyu de las rang gi ngo bos yod pa yin pas na gzhan la'ang rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin tsam du yod pa tsam mam /
analyzed: rgyu de las rang gi ngo bos yod pa yin pas na gzhan la'ang rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin tsam du yod pa tsam mam /
translated: Since it exists by virtue of its own nature, it is also the case that other things exist by virtue of their own nature.üîΩ

original: skyed par byed pa tsam las 'gyur ro zhes shes so //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa tsam las 'gyur ro zhes shes so //
translated: Since it exists by its own nature, it is understood that it is also the mere existence of the nature of things in other things, or it is the mere production of other things.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin la ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rang bzhin 'di thams cad la yod pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni dang po nyid nas yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin la ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rang bzhin 'di thams cad la yod pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni dang po nyid nas yod pa yin te /
translated: Since the nature of things does not depend on anything else, this nature of destruction exists in all things. Therefore, it exists from the very beginning.

original: gang gis skyes pa nyid na 'jig pa'i phyir mtha' dag skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis skyes pa nyid na 'jig pa'i phyir mtha' dag skad cig ma yin no //
translated: Since it is destroyed as soon as it arises, everything is momentary.

original: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig la 'gyur bar mthong ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig la 'gyur bar mthong ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúWhen you see that something changes in some things . . . ‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la 'gyur zhing yod par mthong ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis te rang bzhin tsam gyis so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la 'gyur zhing yod par mthong ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis te rang bzhin tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúSomething‚Äù refers to form and so on. ‚ÄúChanges‚Äù means that it exists by its own nature, that is, by its mere nature.

original: skyed par byed pa tsam las 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa tsam las 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt changes from the mere production of other things.‚Äù

original: skyed par byed pa las gzhan nam /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa las gzhan nam /
translated: because it would be independent of the other, the producer,

original: skyed par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar gcig la skyed par byed pa tsam nyid las 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan la yang yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar gcig la skyed par byed pa tsam nyid las 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzhan la yang yin te /
translated: and it would be independent of the particularities of the producer.üîΩJust as it is in one case, so it is in the other, because there is no difference in the definition of the particularities of the producer and the cause.

original: skyed par byed pa'i khyad par dang rgyu tha dad pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel par grub bo //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i khyad par dang rgyu tha dad pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the mere nature of the thing is established as the concomitant.

original: des na 'dir mthong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las rigs tha dad pa srid pa las byas pa dang yod pa nyid kyis khyab par byed par rab tu grub pa'i rim dang cig car ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig ma ma yin pa las
analyzed: des na 'dir mthong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las rigs tha dad pa srid pa las byas pa dang yod pa nyid kyis khyab par byed par rab tu grub pa'i rim dang cig car ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig ma ma yin pa las
translated: Thus, in this case, the existence of the different types of things is established as pervaded by the effect and existence, which are the concomitants of the aspects of form, etc., that are seen.

original: rang gi khyab par bya ba dang bcas te ldog pa na khyab par bya ba nyid dang lhan cig skad cig ma nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: rang gi khyab par bya ba dang bcas te ldog pa na khyab par bya ba nyid dang lhan cig skad cig ma nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro//
translated: When the non-momentary, which is the counter-correlate of the gradual and instantaneous, is eliminated along with its pervaded, momentariness remains as the pervader.

original: des na skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab pa grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all things are momentary.

original: gang gi tshe tshad mas grub pa'i phung po lnga nyid khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po'i yul yin pa de'i tshe ni dngos po 'jig pa'i rgyu med par bsgrubs pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshad mas grub pa'i phung po lnga nyid khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po'i yul yin pa de'i tshe ni dngos po 'jig pa'i rgyu med par bsgrubs pa na /
translated: When the five aggregates that are established by valid cognition are the object of the relation between the pervader and the pervaded, then when it is established that there is no cause for the destruction of things,

original: yod pa dang byas pa yang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba la ltos pa med pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang byas pa yang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba la ltos pa med pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: existence and being produced are also pervaded by the nature of destruction, because they are not dependent.üîΩIf something is destroyed, then like something that is impeded, it is seen that it arises in dependence on a specific cause.

original: 'ga' zhig 'jig pa yin na ni thogs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du skyed par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pas 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba mthong ba 'ga' zhig po gang yin pa de'i skyed par byed pa de nyid med pas de la ltos pa'iüîΩphyir byas pa ltos pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'jig pa yin na ni thogs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du skyed par byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pas 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba mthong ba 'ga' zhig po gang yin pa de'i skyed par byed pa de nyid med pas de la ltos pa'i phyir byas pa ltos pa med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not the case that the cause of that is nonexistent, it is not the case that being produced is independent.

original: skyes pa phyis 'jig pa yin na yang de 'jig par byed @252a * //
analyzed: skyes pa phyis 'jig pa yin na yang de 'jig par byed @252a * //
translated: If something is destroyed after it arises, then it is destroyed by a cause of destruction.

original: pa'i dus gang yin pa de nyid 'di la nye ba ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i dus gang yin pa de nyid 'di la nye ba ma yin pa yin la /
translated: and the time when it is not is not near to it.

original: de yang rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba yin pa des na de la ltos pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba yin pa des na de la ltos pa'i phyir ltos pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: And since that is due to the incompleteness of other causes, it is not independent.

original: des na 'ga' zhig gam res 'ga' 'jig na ni khyab par byed pa la ltos pa med pa nyid ldog pas na /
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig gam res 'ga' 'jig na ni khyab par byed pa la ltos pa med pa nyid ldog pas na /
translated: Therefore, sometimes or at some times, the pervasion is not independent, and so

original: khyab par bya ba mi dmigs pas skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba mi dmigs pas skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab pa grub po //
translated: the pervasion by momentariness is established by the non-apprehension of the pervaded.
